loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 60 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school. Lydia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Lydia has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mephie

texts.en: Mephie is 30 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Mephie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Mephie has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc. In the future, Mephie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: José Neftali

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años de edad,  estudió hasta tercer grado, ahora está casado y procreó 4 hijos.

José se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura desde los 12 años de edad, actividad que aprendió de su padre quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad, cuenta con mucha experiencia lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona de éxito en la ganadería y agricultura, el lugar donde trabaja con ganado está a 800 mts de su casa y el trabajo agrícola le queda a 4 km en terrenos que son de su propiedad. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar alimentos para el ganado, y para la fabricación de alimento fermentado de caña y maíz, también invertirá en la agricultura.

Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de productos básicos y granos en su municipio, y esto la va lograr con la inversión de las ganancias y la buena administración de un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old. He went to school up to the third grade. Now he is married and has four children.  

José has worked in ranching and agriculture since he was 12 years old. He learned this activity from his father, who spent his whole life doing this activity.  He has a lot of experience, which has made him a successful person in ranching and agriculture. The place where he works is 800 meters from his house and his farming is 4 km away on land that he owns.  

He needs the loan to buy feed for the cattle and to make fermented feed out of sugar cane and corn. He will also invest in the agriculture.  

His dream is to have a business selling basic products and grains in his town. He is going to do this with the investment of the profits and good management of a new loan.

loans.use: to buy feed for the cattle and to make fermented feed from sugar cane and corn. He will also invest in agriculture.

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, apenas pudo realizar sus estudios hasta 6° grado, está acompañado, pero su esposa  no trabaja porque al igual que él no estudio ni la primaria y solo trabaja en su casa con los oficios diarios, ellos son padres de  4 hijos, de edades 32, 30, 25,23 los mayores están casados solamente viven con ellos los dos menores,  ellos trabajan en el campo para poder salir adelante ya que tampoco pudieron superarse y con lo poco que ganan tratan de ayudar con lo que se puede

José se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, desde pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente, se levanta muy temprano todos los días, él también cuida 3 vacas  y todos los días camina 2 kilómetros para poder llegar a la montaña donde las deja parte del día y cada tarde regresa a traerlas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar fertilizantes para fortalecer su cosecha, él piensa vender su cosecha y generar la ganancia suficiente para mejorar su casa,  ya que está en mal estado, su anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder tener un mejor futuro para ellos.

Su deseo es llegar a cultivar por lo menos 28,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, comprar  tres vacas más, de lo cual, espera que sea suficiente para tener algo estable, su mayor sueño es arreglar su humilde casa, y brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia él piensa en el futuro de sus hijos anhela que sea mejor que el de él y su esposa,  ya que han sufrido mucho por no tener los recursos suficientes para salir adelante.
texts.en:
José, 59 years old, was barely able to finish the 6th grade. He is married, however his wife does not have a job, because she, similarly, did not even attend primary school. Thus she only works at home, doing household tasks. They are the parents of 4 children, ages 32, 30, 25 and 23. The oldest are married and only the two younger ones live with them. They work in the fields in order to get ahead since they were not able to improve themselves either and with the little they earn they just try to help as much as they can.

Jose is a farmer. Since he was small he has worked very hard. He gets up very early every day. He also cares for three cows and walks 2 kilometers every day in order to reach the mountain where he leaves them part of the day and then he returns every afternoon to bring them home.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase fertilizer to strengthen his crops. He intends to sell his harvest and generate sufficient profit to improve his house since it is in a bad state. He longs to improve his family’s quality of life and to give them a better future.

He wants to cultivate at least 28,000 square meters of land and to purchase three more cows, which he hopes will be sufficient to have something stable. His greatest dream is to repair his humble house and provide a safe home for his family. He thinks about his children’s future and hopes that it will be better than his and his wife’s since they have suffered so much by not having enough resources to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to strengthen his crop.

loans.name: Santos Tulio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 26 años de edad,  está acompañado y no tiene mucha preparación académica, ahora se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, con  experiencia de 15 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres ya que durante toda su vida fue la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Además motivado por las ganancias que le generaba la venta de golosinas decidió realizar esta actividad los fines de semana y los demás días de semana se dedica a la agricultura.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semilla mejorada para la siembra y también comprará una vaca en estado de gestación la cual cuidará hasta que tenga la cría de esta forma aprovechará la leche que producirá.

Las proyecciones que él tiene a futuro son las de tener un negocio más fuerte que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  y apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Santos is 26 years old. He is married and does not have a lot of education. Now he grows basic grains and has 15 years' experience. He learned this activity from his parents since during his whole life it was the main source of income for his family. He is also motivated by the profits he generated by selling snacks and he decided to do that activity on weekends and the erst of the week he works in agriculture.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and improved seeds. He will also buy a gestating cow ad care for it until it calves and then use the milk it produces.

The projects he has for the future are to have a stronger business that will allow him to serve his customers better, and support his son's education until he graduates from college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved seeds to plant as well as buy a gestating cow which he will care for until it calves and use the milk it will produce.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Roxana tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento una pequeña librería en su vivienda por motivación de su suegra ya que en la zona en el cual vive no había librerías. El crédito en la compra de productos de limpieza para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el grupo “NUEVA ESPERANZA” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Roxana es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en: Roxana is 38 years old and lives with her two dependent children. She was encouraged by her mother-in-law to set up a small bookstore in her home since there were no bookstores in the area in which she lives. The loan will be used to purchase cleaning products to improve her earnings. She is the treasurer for the “Nueva Esperanza (New Hope)” group. The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the loan. Roxana is the second person from the right.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Santos Regino

texts.es:
Santos de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5°grado, porque no tuvo la facilidad económica de seguir con sus estudios, Él está casado y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales ya formaron su hogar y solamente vive él con su esposa, la cual trabaja arduamente en su casa y lava y plancha ropa ajena para ganar dinero extra, juntos tratan de seguir adelante, él describe que con sus esfuerzos espera tener un mejor futuro para los dos.

Santos es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor en todo lo que se propone desde muy pequeño aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura, él describe que madrugaba a trabajar con su padre, al campo, desde entonces él es agricultor, cultiva frijol, maicillo, maíz, él tiene un caballo el cual es su medio de transporte diario para su trabajo, viaja aproximadamente 3 kilómetros, él es un hombre humilde y sencillo pero con un gran espíritu de trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar insumos, como fertilizantes, semilla, funginsidas, foliares, todo lo que sea necesario para que su cosecha sea mejor que años anteriores.

 Él tiene la esperanza, de generar la cosecha suficiente y con las mismas cubrir gastos que son necesarios para él y su esposa, mientras tenga la fuerza suficiente seguirá trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Santos desea en un futuro comprar por lo menos 4 vacas y mejorar la estructura de su casa, ya que él se ha esforzado mucho, para sacar a su familia adelante, él describe que aunque sus hijos estén casados él piensa en él y su esposa, quiere poder llegar a tener un ganado pequeño lo cual le facilitara el trabajo y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
52-year-old Santos studied up until the fifth grade as he did not have the money to continue with his studies. He is married and has four children, who already have their own homes. He lives with his wife, who works hard in the house and does outside washing and ironing to earn extra money. Together they try to get ahead in life. He says that he hopes to have a better future for the two of them due to their efforts.

Santos is a very hard-working and enterprising man. He learned to work in agriculture when he was little. He describes how he would get up early to work with his father in the field. Since then, he has been a farmer. He plants beans, sorghum, and maize. He has a horse, which is his daily mode of transportation for his work. He travels approximately three kilometres. He is an unassuming and modest man, but with a great work ethic. 

The loan he is requesting is for purchasing supplies, such as fertilisers, seeds, fungicides, and foliar fertilisers, all of which is necessary in order for the harvest to be better than previous years.

He hopes to have a good harvest and cover expenses that are necessary for him and his wife. While he has the strength, he will continue working in order to have a better quality of life.

Santos wants to buy at least four cows in the future and improve the structure of his house. Since he has strived to get ahead with his family, he describes how although his children are married he is thinking of himself and his wife. He wants to be able to have a small herd, which will facilitate his work and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fertilisers, seeds, fungicides, and foliar fertilisers, all of which is necessary in order for the harvest to be better than previous years

loans.name: Nelsi Evelin

texts.es:
Nelsi tiene 24 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijas de las cuales solo una estudia y la otra no porque aún está muy pequeña.

Nelsi tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, desde que tenía 18 años de edad decidió emprender este negocio, con el cual ha ayudado en los gastos del hogar a su madre y además le ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijas.


Ella necesita el crédito para ampliar y mejorar su negocio  ya que comprará maíz y gas propano necesarios para la elaboración de tortillas.

Sus sueños son ver a sus hijas graduadas de la universidad, que sean unos profesionales y personas de bien, que le sirvan a su familia y a su comunidad, también quiere ampliar su negocio y montar otra tienda en un caserío de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Nelsi is 24 years old. She has two daughters: one is studying, and the other one is not as she is still very young.

Nelsi has a business selling tortillas. She decided to start this business when she was 18, and with the profits she has helped her mother with the household expenses and helped her daughters to get ahead in life.

She needs the loan in order to expand and improve her business. She will buy the maize and propane gas needed for making the tortillas.

Her dreams are to see her daughters graduate from university and become professionals and decent people who serve their family and community, and to expand her business and set up another store in her community.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business. She will buy the maize and propane gas needed for making tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and to make decoration for his barber shop.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is widowed and lives poorly alone in Tajikistan. She is a hardworking person with a higher education. Hanifa works for more than seven years in a local school, where she is a teacher of small classes. She is one of the successful and smart teachers. Hanifa works hard and thinks that she has a great job, because teaching is a noble profession. Hanifa uses her salary to provide herself with all necessary things.

She is going to repair her house but does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy building materials, such as paint and wallpaper. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Al- Maha Group

texts.en:
This group, Al-Maha, consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a 260,000 YER loan from AMB.

Fatima is the group leader. She is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse in a rented house. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband could accumulate a good amount of money and purchase a piece of land. Fatima supported him with a lot of her own money. The husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the necessary needs of the house.

Year by year, they built their own house on that piece of land. That business cost them a lot of money. They finished the building of the house. Recently, they needed financial support to prepare the house for living. As a result, Fatima is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase doors and windows to complete the renovation of their house in order to live in it.

Fatima's dream in the future is to build more of one floor and to renovate them. She hopes to save the rent money, which she thinks will help improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for renovation.

loans.name: Lelis Rechil

texts.en:
Lelis Rechil is 36 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lelis Rechil is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lelis Rechil has been farming sugarcane for seven years while also earning additional income from pre-paid mobile cards. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisio

texts.es: Elisio, tiene la edad de 55 años, está divorciado y vive con la madre que su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas  además de comprar de almacigo de cefe, el desea dar la mejor asistencia al cultivo de cafe para poder podrucir mas y con ello tener mas ganancias.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Elisio is 55 years old. He is divorced and lives with his mother, who is his greatest priority in life. With the loan, he aims to purchase fertilisers and fungicides, as well as seed starters for coffee. He wants to help his coffee crop as much as possible in order to be able to produce more and have greater profits. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Yesica Yaquelyn

texts.es:
Yesica de 22 años de edad, tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 1 a 5 años, ella solo estudio primer año de bachillerato, se casó a temprana edad, ella no tiene un trabajo estable y su esposo es ayudante de albañil, con esfuerzo tratan de darle lo que pueden a sus pequeños hijos, porque lo que su esposo gana es mínimo.

Yesica decidió vender antojitos (yuca, enchiladas, tostada, frescos etc.) para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a vender estos antojitos, anteriormente vendía con su mamá y su hermana a la vez ella se  dedica a la venta de lociones y visita muchas casas ofreciendo sus productos esperando que alguien le compre algún producto a veces son varios kilómetros los que tiene que caminar, su horario es variado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas o tortillas, ya que esto le generaría más ganancia y no tendría que estar alquilando dinero para sostener su negocio, ella cree que con la compra de la plancha le ayudare mucho y no tendría que caminar tanto para vender sus productos, la idea es fortalecer su negocio y a la vez que le genere una mejor ganancia en la que pueda sostener su negocio y familia.

Ella desea que sus hijos puedan ir a la escuela y puedan superarse, quiere un futuro mejor para ellos, y a la vez ampliar su negocio, buscar un local donde su negocio sea rentable, ella y su esposo planean, salir adelante juntos para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y tener una estabilidad económica en su familia.
texts.en:
22-year-old Yesica has three children between the ages of one and five. She only completed the first year of her high school diploma. She married at a young age. She does not have stable work and her husband is a bricklayer’s assistant. With a lot of effort, they try to give what they can to their small children, because her husband earns very little.

Yesica decided to sell snacks (cassava, enchiladas, tostadas, fruit drinks, etc.) to help her husband with the expenses. She has four years of experience selling these snacks. She previously worked with her mother and sister. She also sells lotions and visits many houses to offer her products, hoping someone will buy a product. Sometimes she has to walk several kilometres. Her working hours are varied.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo is for buying a grill to make pupusas or tortillas, since they generate the most profit and she would not have to borrow money to maintain her business. She thinks that buying the grill will help her a lot and she would not have to walk so far to sell her products. The idea is to strengthen her business and at the same time generate a greater profit so she can support her business and family.

She wants her children to be able to go to school and get ahead in life. She wants a better future for them. She also wants to expand her business and find a location where her business would be profitable. Yesica and her husband plan to get ahead in life in order to give the best to their children and have economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas or tortillas, since they generate the most profit and she would not have to borrow money to maintain her business

loans.name: Rene Alonso

texts.es:
Rene es un joven de 23 años de edad muy, después de estudiar bachillerato sus padres decidieron que comenzara a desempeñarse en su propio negocio, ahora está acompañado y aún no tiene hijos.

Rene tiene una experiencia de 7 años en el negocio de comedores, una vez terminados sus cursos de formación comenzó su negocio de venta de comida, y su actual pareja se involucra y lo apoya en el trabajo.

Él necesita el crédito para pagar muebles y equipo de trabajo que adquirió cuando inició su negocio del restaurante de comida.

Sus planes a futuro son montar otro negocio de comida rápido y algún día procrear hijos con su pareja.
texts.en:
Rene is a 23 year old.  After studying through high school, his parents asked him to began to work in their business.  He now has a partner and does not have children.

Rene has 7 years of experience in the business of dining halls.  Upon completion of training courses, he began his business of selling food, and his current partner engages and supports at work.

He needs the loan to pay for furniture and equipment acquired when he began his business of a lunch restaurant.  His future plans are to establish another fast food business and someday have children with his partner.

loans.use: to pay for furniture and equipment acquired when he began his business of a lunch restaurant.

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
Melca is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Melca works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business of direct selling of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Melca has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in gaining income. They are engaged in making and selling wood carvings and native products within the local community. They aim to make and acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but they have inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy the needed wood, varnish, paints, nails and other native products to resell. Through this financial assistance, Dominga believes that she will improve more of her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy the needed wood, varnish, paints, nails and other native products to resell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and has four children. Helen is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Helen has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additonal livestock to raise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 19 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Edelyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 44 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Cheryll is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryll has been pig fattening for 15 years and earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Philip who is a 54-year-old very hardworking man, ambitious and ever smiling. He halls from the Siongiroi area of Kenya, a very remote place with good weather patterns that support farming and agricultural activities. Philip is a proud father of six children that he really loves and always refers to them as “his heart beat”. Philip is a very dedicated farmer and has so much experience in farming that he is touted to be among the best farmers in his village .Philip has been practicing farming for the past 13 years and through hard work, he has been able to support his family and always provides a plate of food for them. He offers free services to farmers who are still young and free extension services to farmer in the nearby villages.

Philip is seeking funds to open an agro vet shop in his village. This need arose because so many farmers have nowhere to buy animal medicine and food and Philip, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of the ready market that is there and make more profits. Philip is also a farmer and will benefit from the shop because he will not be going far to look for food and medicine, hence cutting down transportation costs.

Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, Philip is confident that this loan will help aspiring farmers like him turn their dreams into reality and through the training he will get, he will be able to successfully run his agrovet shop. As Philip discloses, his determination to succeed in farming springs from the confidence that he has through his many years of farming.

Philip plans to manage his agro vet business in a professional and profitable way and through this, he will assure his family of a secure future and his family will have improved living conditions.

loans.use: To start an agro vet business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like lotion, cologne, and other products to sell.

Edna has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of Avon products for four years and earns additional income from food vending.

Edna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like lotion, cologne, and other products to sell

loans.name: Elverita

texts.en:
Elverita is 53 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, sugar, etc. to sell.

Elverita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and baking powder to make doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like hotdog, chorizo, longganisa, etc. to sell through her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Elvira has been in this business for 3 years. Elvira earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like hotdog, chorizo, longganisa, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, frozen foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, eggs, noodles and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Dawla Dars Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dawla Dars. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.
 
Dawla is a 25-year-old married woman and she lives with her spouse in a poor area in the capital city of Sana'a. The family lives in a very old house which is comprised of only one floor. Dawla works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Dawla's house lacks of many home appliances and furniture. Unfortunately, the income of Dawla's husband is not enough to furnish the house and most of the furniture is old. For this reason Dawla is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new furniture for the house.
 
Dawla looks forward to improving the condition of her family. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Helen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice and direct selling personal collection products.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase toilet pans, pvc pipes, undertile stop corks and toilet cisterns for resale

loans.name: Amilcar Antonio

texts.es:
Amílcar de 33 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de bachillerato general. Él se dedica a la pesca artesanal y su esposa tiene un nivel académico de 7ª grado, ella se dedica a la actividad de ama de casa y comercio de mariscos desde hace 22 años, ella tiene tres hijos pero ya se encuentra en sus hogares independientes. 

Amílcar es una persona que conoce muy bien la actividad que realiza, ya que desde  pequeño ha ejercido dicha labor,  esto lo aprendió de su padre y amigos que fueron quienes lo indujeron a que conociera, por lo que tiene 25  años de realizar dicha actividad,  lo que le permite que  todos los días se dirija hacia la laguna de su lugar para realizar la pesca de mariscos, los cuales prepara por la mañana para que estén listos para la venta.

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para comprar un motor para su lancha y redes que utiliza para la pesca, ya que actual mente la que tiene se encuentran muy deteriorada y necesita mejorar su equipo de pesca para obtener mayores resultados de su trabajo. 

Amílcar tiene como visión poseer un buen equipo de pesca y un lugar estable con buenas condiciones,  como también un negocio que les permita mejores ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Amilcar is 33 years old and finished high school. He is a fisherman while his wife, who has seventh grade education, has been a housewife and has worked selling seafood for 22 years. Amilcar's wife has three children but they now live independently.

Amilcar knows his job very well, having practised it since he was a child. He learned the trade from his father and friends who introduced him to the work. Amilcar has now been fishing for 25 years, allowing him to go out to the local lake every day to fish. He prepares his products in the morning so that they may be sold.

This loan will be used to buy a motor for his boat, and fishing nets. The nets that Amilcar currently has are not in good condition and he needs to improve his equipment in order to have good results at his work.

In the future, Amilcar would like to own good fishing equipment in good condition. He also wants to have a business that allows him to improve his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his boat, and fishing nets. The nets that Amilcar currently has are not in good condition and he needs to improve his equipment in order to have good results at his work.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer joven de 21 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y se dedica a la producción y venta de Queso.
Ella es una persona trabajadora, sencilla, humilde, honesta, perseverante, madrugadora, puntual, emprendedora y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Karhuiza’ a una altura de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, distante a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de la paz.
Nelly es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura mediana, ojos obscuros, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta y pollera), su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su rutina comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada, incluso antes de que los gallos anuncien la alborada, en esta localidad de la zona del municipio de ‘Batallas’, trabajar el insumo lácteo hasta darle esa consistencia característica, es una tradición que es compartida por gran parte de los habitantes. Con pocas ganancias y bastante esfuerzo, diariamente lucha para sacar sus productos frescos a la calle, son muchos los gastos que tiene que hacer para llegar al producto final. El proceso comienza con la leche recién ordeñada, los envases para almacenar el queso se elaboran con materiales de Totora, propia del lugar. “Este trabajo nos da para vivir honradamente y sin lujos. Con lo que ganamos pagamos las cuentas, compramos comida y seguimos trabajando con el queso para comercializarlo, ahora ya tengo cuatro años trabajando de manera intermitente”, comenta Nelly.
El principal problema de Nelly es la poca producción de leche, la época lluviosa fue muy corta y no ayudó a que aumentara el pasto para alimentar a las vacas. Esto repercutió de manera directa en la obtención de la leche, la provisión diaria es insuficiente para aumentar la producción de queso, dependiendo de la época del año, el pasto desmejora y esto merma la producción de leche.
Es por esos motivos que Nelly solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras, aumentar la producción de queso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is 21 years old, single and has no children. She makes a living producing and selling cheese.

Nelly is a hard-working, simple, humble, honest and persevering young woman. She wakes up early and is punctual; she is enterprising and very plucky. Nelly's business is in Karhuiza town, 3735 metres above sea level and 65 kilometres from the city of La Paz.

With tanned skin, long, braided hair, medium height and dark eyes, Nelly wears traditional clothes (a blanket and skirt). Her native language is Aymara but she uses Spanish for her business.

Nelly's day starts very early in the morning, even before the cocks begin to crow. Here in the municipality of Batallas, working the milk to give it its characteristic consistency is a tradition shared by most of the inhabitants. With little profit and lots of effort, every day Nelly works to take her fresh products out to the street to sell. The costs to make her final product are high.

The process begins with milk fresh from the cow. The containers for storing the cheese are made with large reeds that come from the local area. Nelly says: "This work gives us the chance to live an honest, simple life. With the money we earn, we pay our bills, buy food and continue working with cheese to sell it. I have now been working in this intermittently for four years."

Nelly's biggest problem is low milk production. The wet season was very short this year and did not help to increase the pasture for feeding the cows. The directly affect milk production and the daily yield is not enough to increase cheese production. According to the season, the quality of the pasture decreases and this decreases milk production.

As a result, Nelly is applying for a loan in order to buy dairy cows, increase cheese production, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows, increase cheese production, and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz lives in a rural area. He is a very kind and hardworking man. Aziz is married and has three children. He began 10 years ago to own a business in animal husbandry. Aziz feeds cows. He buys cows, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. Aziz’s wife Zuhro helps him manage the business. They work hard to earn a living and to offer their children all the necessary things. He is going to increase his working capital and maximize profit. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos los cuales se esforzó para sacarlos adelante ya que su pareja no le apoyaba mucho.

Lucía se dedica al comercio de ropa, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo con mucho entusiasmo ya que ello significa su subsistencia, sus hijas la poyan en esta actividad siempre que pueden.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería, comprará blusas, pantalones y ropa interior tanto masculina como femenina, es muy necesario el apoyo para que personas luchadoras como Lucia puedan salir adelante.


Sus planes a futuro son mejorar sus ingresos con su negocio de venta de ropa pues es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía is 48 years old and has five children. She worked hard to help them to prosper as her partner was not a great support.

Lucía makes a living selling clothes. She has been doing this work enthusiastically for a long time as this is how she earns a living. Lucía's daughters support her in this work when they can.

Lucía needs this loan in order to buy merchandise - such as blouses, trousers, underwear - for both men and women. For Lucía and people like her, having support is very necessary so that she can get ahead.

In the future, Lucía wants to increase her income from her business as it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise - such as blouses, trousers, underwear - for both men and women.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, spices, etc. to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, and spices to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: vivido toda su vida  , estudio hasta primer grado de primaria es decir el sabe bien poco solo lo básico como es firmar y leer un poco  ya que en eso tiempos  no habían muchas escuelas comunitarias ni sus padres tenían condiciones para ponerlos a estudiar a él y sus hermanos ya que el viene de una familia bien numerosa , su padre le enseño a forjarse como un hombre de bien y luchador para que se pudiera defender en la vida ,  comenta que tienen una familia bien unida de su matrimonio procreo 5 hijos  , sus hijos mayores trabajan con él en la agricultura  siembra de banano, café y   de hortalizas de esta forma el percibe ingresos  para sustento de su hogar, en la comunidad no tienen luz eléctrica  es por eso que quiere aplicar al crédito para comprar un sistema solar y así poder tener luz en su humilde vivienda
texts.en: Misael has a first grade education, meaning that he knows only the very basics - he can sign his name and read a little. When he was a boy there were not many schools in the community. Misael's parents did not have enough money to send him and his siblings to school as he comes from a large family. Misael's father taught him to be a good and feisty person so that he could look after himself in life. Misael says that he has a close family. He now has five children with his wife. His eldest children work with him. Misael grows bananas, coffee and vegetables and, with this work, earns a living to support his household. There is no electricity in Misael's community and so he wants to apply for a loan in order to buy a solar power system. This will allow him to have electricity in his humble home.

loans.use: to buy a small solar power system.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is 45 years old, and lives in Acapulco. He lives lives in a house with his wife and children. He is a department head at Colegio Nacional de Educación Profesional Técnica.

Unfortunately, Miguel has recently gone to the hospital and asks for this loan to pay for the inpatient bills and pharmaceuticals that he needs in order to improve his health. $5,000 Mexican pesos will pay for the hospital expenses and the medication necessary for his complete treatment.

This is his first loan with Konfío and he considers himself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay for hospital bills and medication.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old, and lives in Mexico City. She is divorced and currently lives in a house with her mother and 3 children. Despite several setbacks, she has moved forward in life and currently owns a business that specializes in waterproofing homes.

Ana asks for this loan to buy buckets, rollers, and other products to have material to help expand her business and continue growing to be able to provide the best for her children. $5,000 Mexican pesos will pay for the materials necessary to take on bigger operations.

This is her first loan with Konfío and she considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy materials for waterproofing services.

loans.name: María Mónica

texts.en:
María is 44 years old, and lives in Izcalli. She lives in an apartment with her husband and three children and works as an office clerk at the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.

María's daughter recently gave birth to María's granddaughter and María asks for this loan to pay for her daughter's maternity expenses at the hospital. $3,000 Mexican pesos will help pay for the doctors' and nurses' services and medical attention María's daughter is receiving.

This is her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's maternity hospitalization.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Cynthia Cristal, is married and expecting her first baby.
She works as a nurse at a private hospital, her husband is disabled and not working.
Cynthia requires an eye surgery (not provided by social security), due to her pregnancy situation she is not able to make the full payment and needs a loan which her family will help her pay.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 38 years old, and lives in Mexico City. She lives lives in a house with her husband, two daughters and her in-laws. She is employed in domestic service.

Alicia has a close relationship with her father and has cared for him for the past few years. She asks for this loan to pay for medical attention that her father needs in order to improve his quality of life. $2,000 Mexican pesos will help Alicia's father recover his health and lead a better life.

This is Alicia's first loan with Konfío and she considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay for her father's healthcare needs.

loans.name: Evelyn Aracely

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old, and lives in Mexico City. She is single and lives in an apartment with her two daughters. She works hard at Comisión Federal de Electricidad (Federal Electricity Commission) as an office clerk to provide the best for her daughters.

Evelyn asks for this loan in order to pay for several medical consultations. $5,000 Mexican pesos will pay for the medical attention she requires in order maintain optimal health and keep going to work.

This is her first loan with Konfío and she considers herself a responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay for multiple medical consultations.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en: Tasiu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Tasiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Ashiru,Yusifa, and Ibrahim. Tasiu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Tasiu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Tasiu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Tasiu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sa'adu

texts.en: Sa'adu remembers not being able to pay his children's school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Sa'adu, like all Babban Gona members,  can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Sa'adu. With this loan, Sa'adu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en: Rabiu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Rabiu, like all Babban Gona members,  can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Rabiu. With this loan, Rabiu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Khelcom 7" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Khelcom 7 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Marième Ibrahima, est la présidente ; elle s’active dans la transformation de poisson frais en poisson séché depuis plus de 10 ans. Le crédit lui permettra d’augmenter la quantité de poisson, de diversifier les produits et services, ainsi, elle pourra mettre un peu d’argent de coté. Elle pourra aussi appuyer son époux dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer. 
Marième Ibrahima rêve de construire sa parcelle de terrain et d’y abriter sa famille.
texts.en:
The Khelcom 7 credit association is a sub-group of a network of women who sell fish products for a living. The group is made up of 5 women who have been working in this field for several years and who grouped together in order to benefit from financial aid which will enable them to boost their revenue-generating business. Marieme Ibrahima is the group leader; she has worked for ten years in transforming fresh fish to dried fish. This credit will enable her to increase the number of fish that she uses, to diversify her products and services, and in this way she will be able to put some money aside. She will also be able to help her husband with the family's everyday needs. 
Marieme Ibrahima dreams of one day owning her own patch of land upon which her family will live.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to prepare and sell

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 6" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 6 »Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles ont à leur tête, la dame  Khady qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des chaussures et gère un restaurant non loin de chez elle. Le crédit lui permettra d’acheter de la marchandise des tissus divers et des chaussures à la mode pour revendre. Khady s’occupe de ses propres besoins et donne sa participation dans les charges de la maison.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir un grand magasin de ventes de produits cosmétiques et de tissus de valeur.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Babacar credit association is a sub-group of a network of women who sell fabric and shoes for a living. The group is made up of 5 women who have been working in this field for several years and who grouped together in order to benefit from financial aid which will enable them to boost their revenue-generating business. Lady Khady is the group leader; she has worked for ten years in this field. She sells fabric and shoes and manages a small restaurant near her home. This credit will enable her to purchase different fabrics and fashionable shoes for re-sale. Khady looks after her own needs and contributes to those of the household. Her goal is to open a large store that sells cosmetics and high quality fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 30-year-old farmer from Sabon Layi.  As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. Ibrahim is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children:  Haruna, Lirwanu,  and Usaini. Ibrahim’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have access professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: "lamp Fall Port 8" "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit « Lamp Fall « Port 8  « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Aminata est la présidente du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais depuis maintenant plus de 15 ans. Avec le financement, elle pourra augmenter la quantité de poisson acheté et satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec ce commerce, elle a la possibilité de gagner de l’argent qui lui permet de vivre et de nourrir sa famille car elle participe activement à la gestion des dépenses de la maison.
Madame Aminata désire diversifier son activité en faisant aussi de la transformation de poisson séché et fumé, cette activité sera gérée par sa grande fille qui l’aide au marché.
texts.en: The Lamp Fall Port 8 Beug Manal Sa Bop credit association is a sub-group of a network of women who prepare and sell fish for a living. The group is made up of 5 women who have been working in this field for several years and who grouped together in order to benefit from financial aid which will enable them to boost their revenue-generating business. Aminata is the group leader; she is married and has several children. She has worked for fifteen years in this field. With this loan, she would be able to increase the number of fish purchased, and satisfy her customer demand. With this business, she has the opportunity to earn money which enables her to survive and feed her family, as she actively contributes to the family's expenses. Madame Aminata would like to diversify her business activities by preparing dried and smoked fish; this will be managed by her eldest daughter who helps her at the market.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a maize farmer from Sabon Layi.  As a Babban Gona member, Khalid, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Khalid can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Khalid is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Khalid said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Abu, Masura, and Nasiru, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 10" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 10 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus.
Madame Adama, présidente du groupe, s’active dans le commerce depuis 2009. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon est âgé de 20ans et le benjamin, 7 ans. Elle a démarré son activité avec l’appui de son époux. Elle vend des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs, des pochettes et divers en faisant l’ambulant. Adama ne s’occupe que de ses propres besoins personnels car c’est son époux qui gère les charges familiales.
Adama veut faire du commerce de produits cosmétiques et ouvrir une boutique pour allier les deux activités.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Babacar 10 Beung Manal Sa Bop credit association is a sub-group of a network of women who sell fabric and shoes for a living. The group is made up of 5 women who have been working in this field for several years and who grouped together in order to benefit from financial aid which will enable them to boost their revenue-generating business. Madame Adama is the group leader; she has worked in this field since 2009. She is married and has 5 children; the eldest is a 20 year old boy, and the youngest is 7 years old. She began this business activity with the help of her husband. She sells fabric, shoes, bags, pocket bags and other items via ambulant sales. Adama only looks after her personal needs, as it is her husband who sees to the family's needs. Adama would like to sell cosmetics and open a store in order to link these two businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, shoes, bags and pocket bags for re-sale

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar remembers not being able to pay his childrens' school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Abubakar like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Abubakar,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season due to the yield-enhancing inputs that he will access with this loan such as improved seeds and high quality urea. When asked about his future plans,  Abubakar said: “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Abubakar is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ahmad joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Halilu, Sadi, Amadu and Hamza. Ahmad is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ahmad will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ahmad can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the  national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the money he makes from selling his maize, Ahmad said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family." Ahmad is not thinking about just this year. In 5 years, he wants to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Rubiela es una mujer de admirar pues viene de una familia muy humilde que en muchas ocasiones les faltaba comida en su plato. 

Un día solo se cansó y encontró en la corporación la manera de constituir su negocio convirtiéndose en la primera persona que ayuda a toda la familia, mantiene 4 hijas y le brinda apoyo a hermanas. 

Rubiela es una recurrente prestadora con excelente habito de pago pues debido a la múltiple ayuda que brinda a sus familiares les falta capital para su negocio por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de licores, refrescos, snakc y dulces.

El crédito será de gran importancia pues podrá seguir ejerciendo esta hermosa labor de cooperar a su necesitada familia y tendrá un negocio que le pueda dar estabilidad en la vejez
texts.en:
Rubiela is a woman to admire, as she comes from a very humble family which on many occasions, they lacked food for their plates.

One day she just got tired, and found through this corporation a way to build a business, transforming herself into the first person who helps the whole family, providing for 4 daughters and offering help to her sisters.

Rubiela is a recurring lender with excellent payment habits, as due to the multiple help she offers her family members, they lack the capital for her business so she wants to request a loan to buy liquor, drinks, snacks and sweets.

This loan will be of great importance, as she will be able to continue this beautiful work of providing her family's necessities and she will have a business that can give her stability in her old age.

loans.use: to buy liquor, food and treats such as snacks and sweets.

loans.name: "lamp Fall" Port "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit « Lamp Fall « Port 9 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable du groupe s’appelle Fatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans la transformation de poisson frais en poisson fumé et séché depuis plus de 10 ans. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter du poisson, du sel et de l’herbe pour mener son activité. Madame Fatou participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Son projet futur sera de faire du commerce de légumes pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en: The Lamp Fall Port 9 credit association is a sub-group of a network of women who sell fish products for a living. The group is made up of 5 women who have been working in this field for several years and who grouped together in order to benefit from financial aid which will enable them to boost their revenue-generating business. Fatou is the group leader; she is married and has several children. She has worked for ten years in this field. With this loan, she will purchase fish, salt and herbs in order to boost her business. She sees to her family's daily needs. Her future project will be to cultivate vegetables in order to diversify her business activities.

loans.use: acheter du poisson frais pour le transformer et le revendre

loans.name: Shu'aibu

texts.en: Shu'aibu remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Shu'aibu like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Shu'aibu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Shu'aibu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Shu'aibu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Isah like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Isah,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Isah expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Isah is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mohammadu

texts.en: Mohammadu remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Mohammadu like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Mohammadu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Mohammadu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Mohammadu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en: Shafiu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Shafiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Buhari,and Asamau. Shafiu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, he will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, Shafiu, would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs through this Babban Gona loan, Shafiu can reap 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Shafiu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland. However,  Shafiu is not thinking about just this year; he  said,  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a 35-year- old farmer from Ganji. As a Babban Gona member, Leatu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Leatu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Leatu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Hajara,  Patricia, and  Kenet, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and stockfeeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her chicken farm business and buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: Armando tiene 33 años de edad  vive en la comunidad  caña de castilla es una comunidad bastante poblada, dice que el conto mucho con el apoyo de sus padres así que el tubo la oportunidad de poder estudiar y concluir  su escuela secundaria, hoy día formo su propia familia  vive con su esposa y su hijo  él trabaja en la agricultura siembra de granos básicos  dice que con bastante esfuerzo  ha logrado tener sus propias cosas como es su casa y unas cuantas cabezas de ganado   estas son sus fuentes de ingresos ,  en su casa de habitación tiene un sistema solar instalado que hace unos años compro  ya que necesitaba tener luz , ahora ya es necesario hacerle  el cambio de la batería es por esa razón que está aplicando al crédito para sí comprarla y que su sistema solar siga funcionando .
texts.en:
Armando is 33 years old. He lives in the community of Caña de Castilla, which is a fairly populous community. He says that he relies a lot on the support of his parents, which gave him the opportunity to be able to go to school and finish secondary school.

Now he has his own family: he lives with his wife and son. He works in agriculture, planting basic grains, and he says that with a lot of effort he has been able to have his own things, like his house and some cattle which are his sources of income.

In the house where he lives, he has a solar power system, which he bought several years ago since he needed light. Now the battery has to be changed, and this is why he is requesting a loan, so he can buy the battery and his solar power system will keep working.

loans.use: to buy a part for the solar power system in his house

loans.name: Lindaura Yasileth

texts.es:
Lindaura de 30 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, es madre de dos hijos y siempre ha trabajado con esmero para que a sus pequeños no les falte nada, Lindaura se 

Lindaura tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza, siempre tiene encargos de sus clientas y ha logrado mantener en pie el negocio, además recibe ayuda de su pareja que emigró hacia USA.

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para consolidar unas deudas y para invertir en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

Ella planea abrir alguna cuenta de ahorros destinada para los estudios de sus hijos y que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Lindaura, 30 years old, is an enterprising and very hardworking woman. She is the mother to two children and she has always worked very conscientiously so her little ones would not want for anything. 

Lindaura has worked for several years selling beauty products. She always has orders from her clients and she has managed to keep the business on its feet. She also gets help from her partner, who has emigrated to the USA.

She has requested this loan to consolidate some debts and to invest in her business of selling beauty products.

She plans to open a savings account for her children's schooling and so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to consolidate some debts and to invest in her business of selling beauty products

loans.name: Gabriela Zunilda

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 23 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia, es soltera y vive con su mamá, su padrastro y sus dos hermanas. 
Gabriela nos comenta que nunca contó con el apoyo de su papá, sin embargo tuvo una infancia muy feliz ya que vivía con sus abuelos maternos, tiempo después todo cambio cuando su abuela falleció, ella y toda su familia se fueron a vivir a Perú por tres años e ingreso al colegio donde fue una alumna destacada y sobresaliente. Posteriormente retornaron a Bolivia a solicitud de su abuelo y su mamá inició su propio negocio el cual era la fuente principal de ingresos de su hogar, atravesaron dificultades familiares y los ingresos que tenían ya no eran suficientes, por lo que Gabriela empezó a trabajar los fines de semana como mesera para poder pagar el colegio y ayudar a su familia. 
Al terminar el colegio Gabriela decidió estudiar la carrera de Bioquímica y Farmacia y a pesar de todo lo ocurrido anteriormente, ella se siente afortunada y confía en que cuando obtenga su título profesional todo mejorará. 
Su sueño es ser profesional y realizar una especialidad con el objetivo de salir adelante y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
Gabriela agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán terminar sus estudios y así cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young woman aged 23, who was born in La Paz, Bolivia. She is single and lives with her mother, stepfather and two sisters.

Gabriela says that she never had her father's support, however, she had a very happy childhood living with her maternal grandparents. Some time later, everything changed when her grandmother passed away. Her and the rest of her family went to live in Peru for three years and she started school there, where she was a remarkable and outstanding student.

They later returned to Bolivia at her grandfather's request and her mother set up her own business, which was the main source of household income. They had family problems and their income wasn't sufficient, so Gabriela began working at weekends as a waitress to pay for school and help her family.

When she finished school, Gabriela decided to study a biochemistry and pharmaceutical degree. Despite everything that happened before, she feels fortunate and believes that when she gets her degree everything will improve.

Her dream is to become a professional and specialise in a particular field with the aim of moving forwards and supporting her family financially. Gabriela is grateful to those who, through their economic resources, will allow her to finish her studies and in this way, achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her biochemistry and pharmaceutical decree.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: La labor de Santos es el de mecánica automotriz y su señora tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, son una pareja que no tienen hijos pero han brindado su apoyo y amor a sus  sobrinos, Santos con la ayuda de crédito ha venido mejorando las condiciones de su humilde hogar, ahora solicita el financiamiento para realizar construcción de cuarto que pueda brindar más espacio a la vivienda y gozar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos' work is as a car mechanic, and his wife has her little business selling food. They are a couple without children but they have offered their support and love to their nieces and nephews. 

With the help of the loan, Santos has been improving the conditions of his humble home. He is now requesting a loan to build a room, which will make the house more spacious and allow them to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, iron, and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: Jorge vive en la comunidad caña de castilla, estudio solo la primaria  dice en la escuelita de su comunidad ya después no continuo porque tenía que  viajar por un par de horas  para poder llegar al instituto  de pueblo. Después lo que hizo fue aprender los labores del campo y trabajar con su padre  a sus 25 años de edad se caso tiene una hija  de unos pocos meses de nacida ella y su esposa son su ilusión y la motivación para trabajar todos los días y así sacarlas adelante , su padre le dio unas manzanas de tierra estas dice él las cultiva y de aquí recibe ingresos para los gastos de la familia, en su casa no tiene energía eléctrica y ahora con su hija pequeña  siente que es muy necesaria es por esa razón que desea aplicar a crédito para así comprar un pequeño  sistema solar .
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the sugar cane community of Castilla. He left education after primary school, saying that he didn't continue going after this as he had to travel for two hours to reach the town secondary school.

After this, he learned to work the fields with his father. At 25, he got married and has a daughter who was only born a few months ago. She and his wife are his happiness and his motivation to work every day and support them in this way. His father gave him some plots of land, which he says he farms to make an income to pay for his household expenses. 

His home has no electricity, and he feels that this is necessary now with his young daughter. For this reason, he wants a loan to buy a small solar power system.

loans.use: to buy a small solar power system.

loans.name: Agdia Isabel

texts.es: Agdia Isabel mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos los cuales todos son mayores e independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el oeste del occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación, Agdia es una microempresaria que tiene en su casa de habitación un taller de costura donde confecciona y elabora todo tipo de ropa de niños, adultos, y caballeros al igual que tambien realiza reparaciones de ropa y vende productos naturales,cuenta con seis maquinas de coser eléctricas y dos mesas grandes para realizar los cortes, viene de una familia con pocos recursos económicos el cual solo logra terminar su secundaria para luego ayudar con los gastos del hogar desde muy joven aprende el este oficio el cual hoy en día es propio y el que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos, realiza sus compras en atelier, mercados de esta localidad y de otras, sus ventas son al contado y en algunas ocasiones al crédito, los cuales recupera en poco tiempo, uno de sus sueños es poder tener mejores condiciones en su negocio y el de terminar de realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como: hilos, agujas, cintas, encanjes, diferentes estilos, tipos y colores de telas, siperes, botones, entretelas, tijeras entre otros mas. Agdia agradece muco el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece  a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Agdia Isabel is a middle-aged woman who is married with four grown-up, independent children. She is from one of the villages in Chinandega loacted in the western part of the country. She is known for being an enterprising, hard-working and responsible woman who really wants to get ahead. 

Agdia is a microentrepreneur who has a sewing workshop in her home where she designs and makes all kinds of clothing for children, adults, and gentlemen. She also repairs clothes and sells natural products. She has six electric sewing machines and two large tables where she does the cutting. 

She comes from a poor family, so she left school after secondary school to help out with the household expenses. She learned this business from a very young age, which is hers now and which has helped her to support her children. She buys her inputs from local stores and markets, and sells her clothing in exchange for cash and sometimes credit, which she collects soon afterwards.

One of her dreams is to have better conditions in her workshop and finish making improvements to her business. The aim of this loan is to invest working capital in buying raw materials such as thread, needles, tape, lace, fabrics in different styles, types and colours, zips, buttons, lining, scissors and other items.

Agdia is very grateful for the support offered to those with limited financial resources by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest working capital in buying raw materials to make suits, uniforms and other clothing.

loans.name: Rudylyn

texts.en:
Rudylyn is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school. Rudylyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Rudylyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Rudylyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 23-year-old married lady living with her husband in Irbid-Jordan. 

She is a Diploma student majoring in Accounting. Her aim is to find a good job that will help her pay for her household fees, so she hopes she can get a good job after she graduates.
