En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 46 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, 4 mayores de edad y uno de 15 años que estudia en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Janeth para salir adelante tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, arroz en saquillos y por libras, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  aguas, colas, cervezas entre otros  productos de primera necesidad, trabajan todos días y sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su tienda está ubicada frente a una gasolinera y que por lo general las personas que paran en la gasolinera le compran, lo que más vende es el arroz por saquillos de 25 libras. Tiene más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio con el cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The La Cantera [Quarry] Credit Group meets twice a month in the El Cady section of Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo. Most people in this area farm to earn a living. 

El Cady is the home of Señora Janeth, who is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children, four adults and a 15-year old son who is in high school. Three of the children live with Señora Janeth. Her husband works as a driver. 

Doña Janeth runs a grocery store in her home to earn income, selling a wide variety of products: rice in sacks or by the pound, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, water, colas, beer, and other basic goods. Twenty-five pound sacks of rice are the best-seller. Doña Janeth works every day and her sales are strong; the store is located across the street from a gas station and people who buy gas also visit the store to buy something. 

Doña Janeth has run the store for over 15 years, and the business has allowed her to earn income that benefits her family. She will use the funds from this loan to purchase additional goods for her store: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, and other basic groceries. Doña Janeth has received two loans as a member of the credit group, and she is pleased that this support has helped her business and her family a great deal. Doña Janeth's goals are to keep operating her store and expand her business a little every day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with one child who still attends school and is still under her care. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the child.
	
Faith operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Faith dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough fish to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Irene, a 39-year-old very honest, humble and hardworking mother of one child. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and good climatic conditions that favor farming. She lives in a village where there is no piped water or electricity connection. Irene has been doing farming for the past eight years and through profits from farming, she has been able to support her family. Irene loves dairy farming She has nicknamed one of her cows “Nyamatuka.” She feels really proud whenever she is around her dairy cows. Although she makes profits from farming, this humble mother is faced with challenges of harvesting rain water. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank.

The loan will assist Irene to harvest rain water that is always wasted and be able to use it during dry spells to water her farm. Through the loan Irene will have water for home consumption and this will assist her to save time that she used to spend going to fetch water. Irene is very ambitious and she plans to increase her vegetable production because she will have enough water to use in vegetable farming. Profits from selling vegetables will be used in improving her living conditions and also assuring her child of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 60 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y vive sin ninguna compañía, sus hijos ya están casados, dos viven en los Estados Unidos y solo una reside en El Salvador. 


María se dedica a la sastrería, a ella le hacen pedidos por vestidos de novia, trajes de graduación, cortinas etc. lleva ya 30 años de dedicarse al oficio de forma independiente. Anteriormente trabajaba haciendo oficios domésticos, luego trabajó en un comedor, a ella la contrataron en un negocio de sastrería gracias a su gran capacidad.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar hilos y telas para elaborar túnicas que le han encargado de una iglesia, además comprará botones y zíperes.

María sueña con viajar a U.S.A. y reencontrarse con sus hijos que es lo más valioso que tiene, también sueña con ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
María, age 60, went to school through high school.  She is a single mother, and she lives alone.  Her children are now married.  Two of them live in the United States; only one of them lives in El Salvador.

María is a seamstress.  She gets orders for wedding dresses, graduation outfits, and curtains, etc.  She has been doing this work in an independent manner for 30 years.  She used to work doing domestic chores, and then she worked at an eatery.  A tailoring business hired her thanks to her great ability.

She needs the loan to buy thread and fabric to make robes that a church has ordered from her.  She will also buy buttons and zippers.

María dreams of traveling to the U.S.A. and reuniting with her children, the most valuable thing that she has.  She also dreams of expanding her house.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Sa'ade

texts.en: Sa'ade is a 30-year-old farmer from Barangwaje.  As a Babban Gona member, Sa'ade is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sa'ade can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Sa'ade is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Isah, Yamima and  Yushau. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Nehaya

texts.en:
Nehaya is a 34-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and two kids, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a worker who gets a low and unstable income. 

Three years ago, Nehaya started working in a sewing workshop she owns. she takes orders from local traders. 

Nehaya took a USD loan from FATEN. this loan will help her to buy textiles for her sewing business. By taking this loan, Nehaya will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Nehaya appears in the photo in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy textiles for her sewing business

loans.name: Maryuri Vanesa

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 18, 13, 10 y 6 años que estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. El marido es obrero. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Doña Maryuri con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que siempre le llevan sus trabajos. Lleva más de 7 años con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The La Cantera communal bank meets every 15 days in the El Cady area of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people in this area work in agriculture.

Maryuri, age 34, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has four children, ages 18, 13, 10, and 6.  They attend the university, high school, and elementary school.  Her husband is a workman.  Several years ago she learned dressmaking from an academy in the city.

In order to get her own income and to take advance of her sewing knowledge, Maryuri set up a small seamstress shop in her house.  That is where she makes all types of clothes for women, men, and children.  She likes making women’s or children’s clothes the most, and she works on orders from private individuals who always bring their work to her.  She has been doing this for over seven years, and with this business activity she gets her children ahead.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing materials.  She has been in her communal bank for three cycles.  She likes it because the loans are a big help.  Her dream is to have a larger shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: "lamp " Port 2 "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit « Lamp  « Port 2 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La dame Aminata est la présidente de groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 3 enfants dont des jumeaux un garçon et une fille qui sont ses ainés, âgés de 17 ans et le dernier, un garçon, âgé de 12 ans. Aminata s’active dans la vente de fruits de mer depuis maintenant plus de 20 ans. Avec son capital de 500 000F et le financement reçu, elle pourra renforcer la quantité de sa marchandise. Madame Aminata s’occupe de ses enfants et de leur éducation qui est d’ailleurs possible grâce à la pension versée suite au décès de leur père lors d’un naufrage.
Aminata ne vit et travaille que pour mettre sa famille dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: The « Lamp  « Port 2 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » Group is a subgroup of female business owners and processors of fish products.  The group consists of five women who have been in business for a few years. They regrouped to benefit from financial assistance that will enable them to strengthen their income-generating businesses.  Aminata is the president of the group. She is a widow and mother of three children including twins (a boy and a girl who are older and 17-years old) and a son who is 12- years old.  Aminata has been selling seafood for over 20 years.  With her capital of 500,000 francs and the financing she receives, she will be able to increase the quantity of her merchandise.  Aminata takes care of her children and their education, which is also possible thanks to the pension she receives from the death of her husband in a shipwreck.  Aminata only lives and works to ensure the best living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy seafood for resale,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who still attends school and is still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her child.
	
Mary has operated a business selling clothes, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Mary dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, Mary wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en: Eliso is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the small village of Sachkhere district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.5 hectare agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables. In addition, they have 2 cows and produce dairy products to sell. Eliso wants to expand the dairy business and requested a loan for purchasing an additional cow. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. As the additional cow is purchased, she will be able to produce more dairy products and increase the income. The Start Up program will be a great help for her family. Eliso awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and expand the dairy business

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer from Gidan Zaki. As a Babban Gona member, Ado is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ado can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Ado can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked, Ado said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Abubakar, Yosiya  and  Rhut, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Zaki. Markus is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Markus to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Markus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Markus is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Markus is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Markus will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 8" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 8 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Celle qui a la main levée est la responsable du groupe, elle s’appelle Maguette, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et évolue dans la vente de tissus et d’habillements pour enfants, hommes et dames. Avec le crédit, Maguette aura l’opportunité de pouvoir transporter et dédouaner sa marchandise sans trop toucher à son fond de roulement. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et réussi à mettre un peu d’argent de coté pour pallier à de probables imprévus. Son ambition future serait d’ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de tissus dans sa localité.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra 8 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » Group is a subgroup of a network of female business owners and processors of fish products. The group consists of five women who have been in business for a few years. They regrouped to benefit from financial assistance that will enable them to strengthen their income-generating businesses. Maguette, the woman with her hand raised, is the manager of the group. She is married and a mother. She has been selling fabric and clothing for children, men, and women for over 10 years. With this loan, she will be able to transport her merchandise and clear customs without using too much of her working capital.  She helps with her family's daily expenses and succeeds at setting aside a bit of money to take care of unexpected needs. He goal is to open a large fabric store in her area.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a 35-year-old farmer from Gidan Zaki. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Philibus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Philibus can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the money he makes from selling his bountiful harvest at the end of the season, Philibus said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Josape, Ana and Anoch." Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 10"beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 10 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Fatou est la présidente ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des tissus, des chaussures, des ensembles pour enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine et a démarré avec une minime somme qu’elle a fructifié petit à petit. Le crédit lui permettra d’acheter pour revendre des tissus : du basin, du wax, du voile et aussi des chaussures : sandales, ballerines, chaussures pour enfants. Avec les bénéfices de l’activité, elle appuie son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Madame Fatou souhaite un jour ouvrir son propre magasin et de diversifier en vendant aussi des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra 10 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » Gruop is a subgroup of a network of female business owners and processors of fish products. The group consists of five women who have been active for a few years. They regrouped to benefit from financial assistance that enables them to strengthen their income-generating activities.  Fatou is the president. She is married and  a mother. She sells fabric, shoes, and children't outfits.  She has over 10 years of experience in this industry after starting with a small sum that she parlayed gradually.  This loan will allow her to buy basin, wax, and veil fabric for resale, as well as shoes such as sandals, ballerina flats, and children's shoes.  With the profits from her business, she helps her spouse manage their daily expenses.  Ms. Fatou hopes to one day open her own store and to diversify into selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 30-year-old farmer from Gidan Zaki. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Daniel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Daniel said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my child- Jatro, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my child is educated and has a professional job”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mika joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for hischildren: . Mika is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mika will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mika can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Mika said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Mika is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: José Inmar

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, solo logro a estudiar hasta el 3° grado, lamentablemente su esposa murió, a pesar de todo trata de seguir adelante, con esfuerzo por su edad, él vive solo en su casa sus hijos están casados, y solo lo visitan cuando pueden, él hace lo que puede, ya que por su edad hay mucho que ya no puede realizar, día con día el trata de seguir adelante.

José tiene una pequeña tienda de la que subsiste, tiene 20 años de tener este pequeño negocio, ya que vio la necesidad en su Cantón de una tienda, antes él se dedicaba a la agricultura, todos los días él abre su tienda a las 6:00 am y la cierra a las 6:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, sal, aceite, fósforos, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para poder surtir más su tienda con toda clase de mercadería que sea posible, con la idea de mejorar las ventas y a la vez brindarle más variedad de productos a la gente de su Cantón, él se siente a gusto con su pequeño negocio, ya que cuando se dedicaba a la agricultura su trabajo era más debilitador.
José desea mejorar su vivienda y tener una tienda en la que pueda vender por mayoreo, para que la gente de su cantón no viaje hasta el pueblo a comprar, José se siente con energía para seguir administrando su tienda, ya que lo mantiene ocupado y a la vez es la forma con los que cubre sus gastos.
texts.en:
José, aged 67, managed to study only up to third grade. Sadly, his wife died. Nonetheless, he is trying to go on—with difficulty because of his age. He lives alone in his house. His children are married and only visit him whenever they can. He does what he can. Because of his age, there are many things he can no longer do. He tries to go on day-to-day.

José subsists on a small store he owns. He has had this small business for 20 years now—since he saw the need for a store in his hamlet. Before this he used to make a living in agriculture. Every day he opens his store at 6:00 a.m. and closes it at 6:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to CREDICAMPO to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, salt, oil, matches, candy, beverages, and the like to be able to increase his store stock with as many kinds of merchandise as possible. He aims to improve sales and, at the same time, provide a wider variety of products to the people in his hamlet. He is happy with his small business. When he was making a living in agriculture, his work was more exhausting.

José wishes to improve his home and have a store where he can sell wholesale, so the people in his hamlet don’t have to make the journey to the town to make their purchases. José feels he has the energy to keep on managing his store. It keeps him busy and, at the same time, is the means by which he covers his expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, salt, oil, matches, candy, beverages, and the like to be able to increase his store stock with as many kinds of merchandise as possible. He aims to improve sales and, at the same time, provide a wider variety of products to the people in his hamlet.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi is a 40-year-old farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Titi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Titi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Titi can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mai'unguwa Ayuba

texts.en:
Mai'unguwa Ayuba remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Mai'unguwa Ayuba, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Mai'unguwa Ayuba can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Mai'unguwa Ayuba.   With this loan, Mai'unguwa Ayuba is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé uniquement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niamakoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques, lait en poudre, jus, sacs, calebasses et ustensiles. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques (parfums et pommades). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4cartons de parfums et 3 cartons de pommades  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Niamakoro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists solely of polygamous women. On average, they are about 32 years old and have 4 children each. They all live in Niamakoro, a neighborhood in Bamako, where they all met. The members of this group are into retail: they sell cosmetics, milk powder, fruit juice, bags, gourds and utensils. In order to increase their business, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their first solidarity loan.  
Mrs. Aminata (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of cosmetics (perfumes and ointments). She intends to use her loan to buy from wholesalers in Bamako: 4 boxes of perfumes and and 3 boxes of ointments. She will resell them in Niamakoro to various individual customers. With this loan, Mrs. Aminata hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA, which will be reinvested in her business. Through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, she plans on buying a plot of land for residential use.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Al- Kahraba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kahraba. It consists of four women from Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Sabah is a 42-year-old married woman, living with her family in their own house in Mokala, Yemen. She is an  educated woman. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Sabah wants to help her husband to improve the living conditions of the family. She says that her house lacks many home appliances; most of the ones she has are very old, and she can't afford new ones. Mokala city has a hot climate year-round, particularly in the summer season. Unfortunately, the air-conditioner of the house has become very old. They need a new one. For this reason, Sabah is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new air-conditioner for the house.

Sabah looks forward to taking another loan from Kiva in order to prepare her house with all necessary home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a new air-conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna Sabo is a 40-year-old farmer from Ungwan Tube.  As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna Sabo, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohanna Sabo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yohanna Sabo is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Yohanna Sabo is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Osiya and  Prances. Yohanna Sabo’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a 25-year-old farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Dauda is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Dauda is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Dauda’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima. Silas is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Silas to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Silas can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds, Silas can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. Silas is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Silas will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima. Joshua is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Joshua to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Joshua can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Joshua is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access yield-enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Joshua is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Joshua will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as red oil, rice, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en:
Gladys appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where her customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, leading to losses of perishable goods.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima. Salamatu is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Salamatu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salamatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds, Salamatu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. Salamatu is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked, she said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, Salamatu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Wendy Edith

texts.es:
Wendy tiene 21 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 6º grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos pequeños, uno va a la escuela y el otro está muy pequeño.


Wendy tiene muchos años poseer un negocio de refrescos, frutas y verduras junto a su hermana, fue la necesidad la que llevó a Wendy a trabajar en esta actividad, se levanta todos los días a las 4:00AM para ir a comprar al mercado lo que necesita para la venta.


 
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más mercadería como rinso, jabón y otros productos que mas buscan los clientes, de esa forma tendrá mas ingresos y mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.

El sueño de Wendy es tener un puesto mas grande y tener de todo lo que los clientes buscan, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wendy is 21 years old, and she only went to school through 6th grade. She is a single mother to two small children; one goes to school, and the other is still too young to go to school.

Wendy has had her own business selling drinks, fruits and vegetables with her sister; she began to work in this sector out of necessity. She wakes up every day at 4am to go out to purchase what she needs to sell in the market.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as laundry detergent, soap and other products that her clients want to buy. This way she will have more income, and will improve the quality of life for her and for her children.

Wendy's dream is to have a bigger stall, and to have everything that her clients look for, to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as laundry detergent, soap and other products that her clients want to buy.

loans.name: Cristian Giovanni

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 25 años de edad, nunca asistió a la escuela pues sus padres creían que estudiar no era importante, está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno asiste a la escuela.

Él se ha dedicado por más de 8 años a la albañilería como trabajo principal, el cual aprendió con un amigo suyo, además en tiempos que no hay trabajo como albañil se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra maíz y frijol,  trabaja fuertemente todos los días para que no falte el sustento en su casa.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas que aplicará a su cultivo, además pagará mano de obra que le ayudará en las actividades que demanda el cultivo y así tener buenas cosechas.

Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos a que se preparen académicamente, además mejorar su casa y sobre todo que la cosecha sea lo suficientemente grande para cubrir sus necesidades alimenticias y vender una parte para cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
25-year old Cristian never went to school as his parents believed that education was unimportant. He is married; his wife looks after the home. They have two children, one of whom attends school.

For more than eight years Cristian has for the most part earned his living in construction. He learned his skills along with a friend. As time went by there were no jobs for a bricklayer so he turned to farming. He grows maize and beans and works very hard to ensure there is always food for his family.

Now Cristian needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops. He will also hire laborers to assist him in the fields so that he can have a good harvest.

His dreams for the future are to see his children educated, to make improvements to his house, and above all to have a harvest that is large enough for him to cover necessities like food, and to sell part of it so he can pay back the loan.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hire laborers

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to finally access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from his farm, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Samaila can reap up to 30 bags of maize per hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to expand my farmland, and provide a better education for my children: Lamek and Amaziya.” With this loan, Samaila is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy some bullocks

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hello, World! Meet Hyline, a very hard-working mother who is 21 years of age. She is very ambitious and a go-getter. She hails from Nyamira area of Kenya, an area that is primarily a banana-growing region. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and crop farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She is a mother of three, and this really motivates her to work hard so that they can have a bright future. Being raised with a humble background has taught Hyline to always be a hard worker and never to lose hope. Hyline never got any formal employment but that did not kill her morale. She started farming and has been doing it for five years.

Hyline is passionate about farming, but dairy farming is one aspect of the business that she enjoys most. She has always wanted to keep more quality dairy cows, but she faces financial problems. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow.

Hyline wants to improve her dairy farming in such a way that will bring more income because she has a large family to take care of. The quality cow will be beneficial not only to produce milk, but also to provide manure to increase productivity on her farm. Because of the good financial track record and financial discipline that Hyline has, she will be able to pay the loan on time and also improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is married and has eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall, where she serves neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in number of clients, which sometimes leads to loss of perishable goods. 

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est  uniquement composé  de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons) et des poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs d’oignons  en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coro à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fanta  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma is composed just of polygamous women, who average 45 years of age and two children each. The women all live in Kalaban-coro, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments (onions) and fish.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fanta (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling condiments (onions). She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of onions wholesale in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kalaban-coro. 

With this loan, Ms. Fanta hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this Soro Yiriwaso relationship.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Arabani Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Arabani ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Badialan III. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, oignons et charbon du bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assétou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse  d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 pièces en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Badialan III à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Assétou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married in polygamous families only, the four members of the group Arabani average 43 years of age and four children each. The women all live in Badialan III, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses in Badialan III. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing, that is, Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of the best quality; onions; and charcoal. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Assétou (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of the best-quality clothing (Wax ‘pagne’ cloth). She intends to use her loan to purchase 35 lengths wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Badialan III. 

With this loan, Ms. Assétou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, agricultural inputs and to pay the labor to plant seeds and to help with her corn harvests.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé majoritairement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niamakoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies) de meilleures qualités, lait en poudre et de condiments. . Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sabou  (femme debout en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Niamakoro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sabou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma is composed mostly of polygamous women, who average 29 years of age and three children each. The women all live in Niamakoro, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving the best-quality clothing (secondhand), powdered milk, and condiments.

With the goal of building up their inventories, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sabou (the woman standing third from the right in the photo) is famous for selling clothing (used) of the best quality. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing wholesale in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Niamakoro. 

With this loan, Ms. Sabou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this Soro Yiriwaso relationship.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan tiene 39 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela por la situación económica que vivían sus padres y la guerra, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja vendiendo tortillas, tienen 6 hijos y solo 3 están estudiando, nadie mas vive en casa.


Juan se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz y pipían toda su vida, oficio que aprendió de su padre y el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su día comienza a las 6:00 am pues madruga a ordeñar una vaca, luego enyuga sus bueyes y se dirige al trabajo, para llegar donde está su cultivo camina 40 minutos y su horario de trabajo es de 8 horas, luego regresa a casa.


El crédito solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar semilla, abono y veneno.

Sus sueños a futuro son ver a sus hijos graduarse en una carrera universitaria ya que él no pudo,  perforar un pozo donde él trabaja y tener riego en el verano, comprar un carro para poder llevar su producto al mercado y con las ganancias pagar el crédito.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old. He never went to school because of his parents' financial situation and the war. He has a domestic partner and she works selling tortillas. They have 6 children and only 3 of them are studying; nobody else lives at home. Juan has worked growing corn and pipian (a type of squash) his whole life. He learned this from his father. This has allowed him to move his family ahead. His day starts at 6:00 am, because he wakes up very early to milk a cow. Later he yokes his oxen and goes to work. In order to get to his crops he walks 40 minutes, and his work schedule is 8 hours. After that he returns home. He is requesting a loan to CrediCampo to buy seed, manure and poison. His dreams in the future are to see his children graduate with a college career because he was not able to do it, to drill a well where he works and have irrigation in the summer, to buy a car so he can bring his product to the market, and with the earnings to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure and poison.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en el trabajo agrícola y en el comercio de camarón, tiene una hija que está en el kinder y nadie mas vive con ellos.


Eugenio se dedica al comercio de camarón desde hace 8 años, él tiene un estanque donde cultiva el camarón, además trabaja en la agricultura oficio que aprendió con su padre, también tiene un equipo para perforar pozos, eso lo aprendió con un amigo, su vida es un poco agitada, él se levanta a las 5:00 am y se dirige al trabajo agrícola, por la tarde atiende su vivero de camarón, todo lo hace con mucha dedicación ya que son los medios con los que saca adelante a su familia.


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar concentrado para el camarón. 
 
sus sueños son que su hija se prepare en una carrera profesional, construir su propia casa ya que hoy vive en casa de su mamá, también tener su propia empresa camaronera y darle trabajo a mas gente que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 29 years old and finished high school.  He is in a relationship and his partner helps him in farming work and selling shrimp.  Eugenio has a daughter in kindergarten, and no one else lives with him and his partner.

Eugenio has worked at selling shrimp since he was 8 years old.  He has a tank where he grows the shrimp.  He also works at farming, having learned this from his father, and he owns equipment to drill wells for water, and learned this work from a friend.  His life is a bit hectic.  Eugenio gets up at 5 AM and attends to his farming; in the afternoon he takes care of his shrimp cultivation.  He does all his work attentively since these are the the ways that his family can get ahead.  

Eugenio will use the loan to buy concentrated feed for the shrimp.  His dreams are that his daughter will prepare for a professional  job and that he will build his own house, since he now lives in his mother's.  He also dreams of having his own shrimp enterprise and being able to provide work to more people who need a job.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for shrimp

loans.name: Doris Alicia

texts.es:
Doris tiene 36 años de edad, es bachiller, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como albañil, tiene cuatro hijos y nadie mas vive con ellos.


Doris se ha dedicado al negocio de las ventas de pasteles, enchiladas, tamales y mas, lo hace desde los 10 años y fue con su mamá que aprendió el oficio, los estudios de bachillerato los llevó a cabo durante los fines de semana, su día comienza a las 5:00 am preparando desayuno para su familia y mandar a los niños a la escuela, por las tardes con su hija mayor hacen pasteles, enchiladas, elotes locos, yuca y mas.


 El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos de la canasta básica para surtir su negocio, ya que hay muchos productos que no tiene y sus clientes buscan.

 
Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria, también poder mejorar su vivienda y pagar el crédito para tener puertas abiertas con esta institución.
texts.en:
Doris is 36 years old and graduated from high school. She is married; her husband works in construction. They have four children, and no one else lives with them. Doris earns her living selling pastries, enchiladas, tamales etc. She's been doing this work for ten years and learned it from her mother. She completed high school by attending classes at weekends.

Doris's day begins at 5am when she prepares breakfast for her family and gets the children off to school. In the afternoons with help from her oldest daughter, she makes pastries, enchiladas, tamales, grilled corn and yucca etc. She needs a loan to buy basics as stock for her store since there are many items that her customers need and she doesn't have. 

Doris's dreams are to see her children attend university, to be able to make improvements to her house, and to pay off her loan so this institution will help her in the future.

loans.use: Buy basics as stock for her store

loans.name: Eduardo Eleazar

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven muy inteligente y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, estudia mecánica de producción y esta en su ultimo semestre académico, a punto de acabar su carrera y graduarse. El vive con su madre y hermana, su padre falleció hace apenas 2 meses, por lo que de improviso se convirtió en el hombre de la familia. Su madre tiene un pequeño negocio de comida y es el único sustento del hogar tras la muerte de su esposo. Ella esta orgullosa de Eduardo ya que sera el primer miembro de la familia en llegar a ser profesional, algo que no se dará de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Eduardo financiaba sus estudios gracias a la ayuda económica que significaban los ingresos que generaba su padre, pero tras el fallecimiento de este ultimo la situación económica de su hogar a cambiado dramáticamente. Es por esto que necesita de la ayuda de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder culminar sus estudios y comenzar a laborar para poder ayudar a su madre en los gastos y a su hermana menor en sus estudios.
El desea decirles a los prestamistas de Kiva que no les fallara, que esta a puertas de concluir su educación superior y que próximamente el mismo podrá pagar sus cuotas y que agradece toda la ayuda que puedan brindarle de antemano confiando en salir adelante junto a su familia.
El tiene el sueño de trabajar en una gran empresa para adquirir mas conocimientos, seguir estudiando y ser un mejor profesional para en un futuro poder poner su propio taller y dar practicas a jóvenes que como el están deseosos de aprender y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a very smart young man who is very interested in getting ahead. He studies production mechanics, and he is in his last academic semester, almost ready to finish his major and graduate. He lives with his mother and his sister.  Eduardo's father passed away just two months ago, which has suddenly made him the man of the family. His mother has a small food business, which is the only support that the home has after Eduardo's mother's husband passed away. Eduardo's mother is very proud of him because he will be the first member of the family to have a university degree, something that he could not have one without the support of those who loan through Kiva. Eduardo financed his studies thanks to economic support from his father, but after his father's passing, the economic situation of his home has drastically changed.

This is why he needs the help of Kiva loaners to be able to finish his studies and begin to work to be able to help his mother with her expenses and to help his younger sister with her studies. He would like to tell the Kiva loaners that he will not fail them, that he is so close to finishing his higher education, and that very soon he will be able to pay his monthly payments. He is thankful in advance for all of the help that they can give him, trusting that he and his family will be able to get ahead.

Eduardo dreams of working for a big company to learn more, continue studying and to be a better professional worker so that some day he can have his own studio and teach young people like him who are eager to learn and get ahead.

loans.use: to finish his last cycle of classes in production mechanics.

loans.name: Hineso Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Hineso sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, pommes de terre, chaussures, condiments et habits. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Sali  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  la pomme de terre est très prise par les femmes dans le marché de Kalaban-coro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs  de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent à  Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Kalaban-coro  à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 60 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
Composed of five women, the members of the group Hineso are for the most part married and live in polygamous households. The women average 43 years of age and four children each. The women all live in Kalaban-coro, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of their tontines in the district and their different revenue-generating businesses, especially the selling of potatoes, shoes, condiments, and clothing. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Sali (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous, since potatoes are highly prized by the women at the Kalaban-coro market. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of potatoes. She gets her supplies in Médine. She runs her business accepting cash from a customer base of women in Kalaban-coro.

With this loan, Ms. Sali plans on making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting her needs and investing the rest in her business. Her goal is to gain confidence in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to take advantage of a number of loans.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Sol De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “SOL DE VITARTE”.  La Sra. BLANCA   de 46  años de edad casada y con 6  hijos, la Sra. BLANCA   tiene una pequeña bodega  hace unos  20 años. La Sra. BLANCA  con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante tanto así que  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos (AZUCAR, LECHE, MENESTRAS, ABARROTES, ETC) y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. BLANCA  y  todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. BLANCA  es la 4 persona de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su casaca de color marrón, se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group of 8 entrepreneurial women who show great creativity in their businesses: this describes the members of the communal group "SOL DE VITARTE".

Blanca is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  Blanca has a kept a small shop for about 20 years.  With the help of her family, she has known how to get ahead, so that she has faithful customers.  This has generated profits to cover her household costs.   She will use the loan to buy more products  to sell (sugar, milk, soups, groceries, etc.) and thus continue meeting her customers' needs and making progress.  

Blanca and the other members area are grateful for Kiva's help through the loan and for the trust placed in them.  Blanca is the fourth person from the right in the photo, wearing a brown jacket.  She says farewell, promising to fulfill all her goals.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Benkadi est constitué de quatre femmes  majoritairement mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, tubercules (pommes de terre), parures et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna (Assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des tubercules (pommes de terre). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coro au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maïmouna compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Thi group, Benkadi, is composed of four women for the most part married and living in polygamous households. The women average 34 years of age and three children each. The women all live in Kalaban-coro, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of their tontines in the district and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce, such as the selling of tubers (potatoes), fine merchandise, and clothing. 

With the goal of increase their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Maïmouna (sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling tubers (potatoes). She intends to use this loan to purchase 4 sacks of potatoes. She gets her supplies in Médine. Her sales are made in cash to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kalaban-coro.

With this loan, Ms. Maïmouna plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting her children’s sundry needs and investing the rest in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to attain her goals, which include expanding her business

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and has two kids who attend school. She has owned a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. In addition, she also operates a crop farming business which earns her other source of income. Her major challenges is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married and has eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years she has owned a food stall business for neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in her number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as diapers, washing soap, Pampers, etc., to sell

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado y está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.

María se levanta junto a su esposo a la 5:30 a.m  para realizar sus actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el cuido del ganado, oficio que realiza durante la mañana, en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a elaborar queso para venderlo entre sus vecinos y alrededores de su residencia

	Ella necesita el crédito para comprar tres vacas lecheras que un vecino le está vendiendo y así poder incrementar la producción de leche que le generará mayor ingreso.

Sus planes son que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de queso, de la siembra y del préstamo comprar más vacas.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and studied through sixth grade.  She is in a relationship and her partner works in farming.  Maria has two children who are her dependents.  Along with her husband, Maria gets up at 5:30 AM to carry out her daily work centered in farming and caring for cattle, work she does in the morning.  As the afternoon passes, she milks the cows and makes cheese to sell to her neighbors and in areas near her home.  

Maria needs the loan to buy three milk cows a neighbor is selling and thus increase the production of milk which will provide her more income.  Her plans are that with the income she gets from selling cheese, from planting crops, and from the loan she will buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy three milk cows a neighbor is selling and thus increase the production of milk which will provide her more income

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios, ella es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años de edad, la cual está estudiando en la escuela.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, tiene 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo, y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, ella decidió dedicase a esto porque le generaba ingresos para salir adelante con su hija.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar material para la elaboración de hamacas, pues pretende mejorar su negocio con el cual mantiene s su familia.

Ella sueña con tener siempre la materia prima para no verse estancada en su trabajo de elaboración de hamacas.
texts.en:
Lilian, 29 years old, studied through 6th grade.  Because of limited financial resources, she could not stay in school.  Lilian is the single mother of a 6 year old daughter who is in school.  Lilian works at making hammocks.  She has 15 years of experience doing this and learned it from her parents.  She decided to earn her living this way because it provides enough income to get ahead along with her daughter.   

She needs the loan to buy materials for making hammocks, since she wants to improve the business with which she supports her family.  Lilian dreams of always having the basic materials so as not to be unable to work at making hammocks.

loans.use: to buy materials for making hammocks, since she hopes to improve the business with which she supports her family

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Jemimah, 41 years of age, very ambitious, very hardworking and the mother of four beautiful children that she really adores. Jemimah hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, a banana growing region. She is very charming and you can always feel a happy feeling when she is around her family. She has been doing farming for the past five years and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a very young age and now I am independent." She practices mixed farming; that is crop farming and dairy farming and has been able to earn a decent income and be able to support her family. Jemimah has got a large piece of land and wants to start poultry farming on her land also. The Nyamira area is a highly populated area and has a great demand for poultry eggs and poultry products and because of the above valid reason she is seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Through the loan Jemimah will be able to sell her products to the nearby market and also to her neighbors and she will be assured of improved living conditions. Profits from the business will be used to repay the loan and also through the loan Jemimah's dream of developing her business enterprise will be achieved. She will be able to give her family what they need without any limitations.

Jemimah is very visionary and she projects that after a short period of time she will be able to expand her business and buy more poultry .

loans.use: to start poultry farming

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past three years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman; she has seven children, all of whom attend school. Mnyazi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Mnyazi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal to increase her selling stock and meet the interests of her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a goat meat business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase seven goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (onions, washing soap, tomatoes, coal, cube, rice, etc) to sell.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is married with seven children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a charcoal business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a married woman with seven kids who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Kupha is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods, such as toothpaste, washing soap, batteries, spray, etc

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Janet, a 19-year-old, very hardworking, self-driven mother of four adorable children that she really loves and treasures. Janet hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area always referred as a banana growing region. Janet is very young and was raised in a challenging circumstance; for being 19 and a mother of four, she has to work even extra hard so that she can put food on the table for her large family. She has been practicing farming for the past five years, and her main source of income has been milk selling, crop farming, and some personal business so that she can make ends meet.

Although she makes profits, it’s not enough.  That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming and boast her family and also be able to improve her standard of living. The Nyamira area has a ready market for eggs and poultry products, and she is sure that she is going to reap more profits and turn around her life.

Accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, and being a mother it makes the issue challenging, but Janet feels relieved knowing that there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women achieve their goals.

Through the loan Janet will be able to support her school-going children, and be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as onions, rice, tomatoes, milk cubes, coal, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en:
Munyazi is married with ten children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a charcoal business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Yenny, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  11, 6 y 3 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
