Doña Yenny con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días por sin un horario fijo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 2 años en su negocio con el cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Esta de en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady in Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, members of the "La Cantera" ["The Quarry"] communal bank meet every two weeks. In this location, most people work in agriculture.

In this place lives Yenny. She is 35 years old and married; from that marriage, she has three children who are 11, 6, and 3 years old. The older children study in primary and secondary school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Yenny, with the goal of having her own income for household expenses, earns her living selling Yanbal and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works every day, but without a fixed schedule. Her sales method is door-to-door. She sells on credit and bills every eight days. With this business, she has earned something for the good of her family for more than two years.

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams. She likes the communal bank because the loans really help. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Jorge Manfredo

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado en la escuela está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Jorge se dedica al destazo de cerdos y de ganado,  cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo, lo inició hace un tiempo en que no conseguía trabajo.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar 3 cerdos para engordarlos y tener de reserva en su casa.

Su sueño es reunirse con su esposa ya que se encuentra fuera del país, y de esta manera ver otra vez a su familia unida.
texts.en:
Jorge, 37, has a 6th grade education.  He has a wife and 3 children who are in school.  Jorge is a butcher.  He has 5 years of experience in this line of work.  He started this work at a time when he could not find a job.

Jorge needs a loan to buy 3 pigs to fatten and have in reserve at his house.  His dream is to get back together with his wife, because she is currently out of the country.  This way, they could have a united family once again.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as used clothes to sell

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a goat meat business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase seven goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats for resale

loans.name: Aisa Isabel

texts.es:
Aisa tiene 30 años de edad, no pudo seguir estudiando ya que sus padres no se preocuparon por darle la oportunidad  para que él fuera a la escuela, por lo tanto mejor se dedicó a trabajar, está acompañado y tiene un hijo.

Aisa  trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre, además trabaja en un corral ordeñando ganado bobino.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar 3 cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, también comprará abono para su cultivo y así obtener mejores cosechas.


Su sueño es que el negocio de engordar cerdos vaya mejorando para que le genere mejores ganancias  para poder dar a su hijo y su esposa mejores condiciones de vida y lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y de los créditos.
texts.en:
Aisa, 30, was not able to continue with his education because his parents were not concerned with giving him the opportunity.  Therefore it was best that he leave school and go to work.  He has a partner and a child.

Aisa has been working as a farmer for 10 years.  His father taught him to farm.  In addition, he works in a corral milking cows.

Aisa needs a loan to buy 3 pigs to fatten and sell.  He will also purchase organic fertilizers for his crops so that he can get a better harvest.  

Aisa's dream is to expand his livestock business so that he could generate more earnings to give to his son and his wife.  This way they can have better living conditions.  Aisa will accomplish this with the help of God and the loans.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Meshack, 55 years of age, a very energetic, hardworking and focused farmer. He hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area referred to as “a banana region” and their staple food is a “matoke”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. He is a family man, and he has nine beautiful children that he really loves and adores. 

Meshack has a wealth of experience in farming because he has done farming for 34 years and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Meshack loves dairy farming, and has even nicknamed one of his cow “Nyabarati”.

Meshack practices mixed farming, and through that he has been able to take care of his large family, not everything has been good for this humble and hardworking man. 

The Nyamira area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs, and Meshack being an enterprising person would want to take advantage of that and make profits. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Meshack has got enough space on his farm and wants to make use of the space through poultry farming.

Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, Meshack will also get manure to use in his farm, hence the money that could have been used in buying it will be saved.

Meshack projects that after a few months he will have more income to buy more poultry and also pay back the loan.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Olinda Rosalia

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Olinda, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Olinda con su esposo para salir adelante desde hace 8 meses instalaron un  pequeño comedor en su casa, allí preparan el  delicioso encebollado de pescado, plato que es muy apetecido por sus clientes que siempre llegan a su local a comer. Allí junto al esposo brindan la mejor atención ya que para ellos sus clientes son lo más importante ya que así su negocio mejora cada día más.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado y otros víveres para la preparación del encebollado. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo the members of the Grupo de Credito La Cantera [The Quarry Communal Bank] meet every fifteen days. Most of the people in this area make a living in agriculture.

Olinda lives in this place. She is 54 years old, married and has three children from this relationship. One is an adult and the other two are 17 and 15 years old and study in high school. Her husband is a driver.

Olinda and her husband, in order to get ahead, set up a small eatery in their home eight months ago. From there they prepare a delicious fish ‘encebollado’ (stew made from fish, onion and cassava), a dish craved by her customers who always arrive at her place to eat. Along with her husband they provide better service because to them, their customers are very important. In this way their business improves more each day. 

She will use this loan to buy fish and other food supplies for the preparation of the ‘encebollado’. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and she likes the help the loans give her. Her dream is to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food supplies.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is 31 years old and is married to a farmer, with whom she has two children (one son and one daughter).  Both children attend school.  One is in grade seven and other is in primary standard. Minu and her husband are illiterate, and can sign their names only.  They live in the small village of Kathalbari which is at Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Minu is a homemaker who looks after her household, whereas her husband has for the last few years earned a living by planting and harvesting rice.  She helps her husband sowing, planting, and growing seeds. To give a financial sustenance to his family, he wants to extend his business, so Minu is applying for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, paddy seeds, and other things.  These investments will help Minu boost up her rice yield.  She plans to keep investing, expanding her land, increasing her harvest, and earning more income so she can provide for her children. She also wants to invest part of her earnings in the purchase of a small plot of land that she can work herself.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his roti (flat bread) restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant more greens to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in metal art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including sheet metal, paint, and metal profiles.

Jesus has been selling through NOVICA since 2003, working under the artistic name "J. Blas". This is his story:

"When I was 17, I started my own ceramic workshop. But I changed directions and began to work in wrought iron and blown glass. I experimented with sheets of iron to give my works more movement. We cut the metal sheets, hammer them into shape and weld them before treating them against rust. Every piece created at my workshop goes hand in hand with originality, design and quality. We are always developing new designs and products.

For us artisans, this microcredit represents a very important source of support. It allows us to improve our working conditions and motivates us to continue working every day to improve our craft. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Jesus's metal wall art on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3675

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including sheet metal, paint, and metal profiles

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a loving and hardworking mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is 30 years old and completed education up to grade 8. She lives with her two children and husband Pradip, 33 years old, in the small village of Daspara in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made). Maya's husband Pradip attended school up to class 5 (grade 5).  He is a shopkeeper. He sells grocery items daily from his small shop which is very adjacent to their house. One of their children is a student in the primary standard and the other is below the school-going age.

Maya always prioritizes her children's future, which is why she has not been tired of doing things to give them a better way of life. Maya helps her husband to run the grocery store within the locality, where biscuits, bread, butter, spices, flour, and other kinds of grocery items are sold. They have chosen this business as there is no other grocery store in her locality.

Now she aims to improve their grocery shop due to the increasing demands of her customers. But to expand her business, she needs capital. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy grocery items to meet the demands of her customers and, at the same time, improve her financial stability and impart a proper education to her children.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Putu Gede

texts.en:
Putu Gede is an artist and designer who specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semiprecious gemstones for his jewelry pieces.

Putu Gede has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"I love to create something based on traditional styles and combine them with a modern look. I've come to realize the importance of having a skill, so I've made a point of offering free training in silversmith techniques. My hope is that by doing so, people in need will be able to earn a living and support their family.

I need some capital to increase my stock on hand. This microcredit is a great opportunity that will allow me to buy silver and gemstones. I am happy with this, because an increase in my sales will help me to give jobs to the people in my community. From that I can add more new designs, too, and add more jobs for artisans. I am grateful to you who support me with this loan, who support my business and all the people involved in working with me to produce my jewelry."

Use the link below to view Putu Gede's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6981

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semiprecious gemstones for his jewelry pieces

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi, a housewife from Maynaguri, is young, active, and enterprising.  She is 24 years old and a mother of one lovely son.  She and her husband both completed up to grade 9.  She lives in a remote village Sahapara in the Jalpaiguri district with her husband and son.  Their son reads in primary level.

A few years back, along with her husband Gadadhar ( 29 years old), she started a business of selling clothing (mainly sarees, a ladies'  garment) so they can establish sustainable income sources.  She purchases sarees in bulk quantities and sells them to their neighbors.  In this way, he earns for the family's livelihood. 

But his scanty income can hardly cover their household expenses. They need to expand their business by purchasing more clothing.  The profits they will make will increase their income, and empower them to realize their dreams of a good future for their children.  With this aim, Madhabi is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase sarees from wholesale market to improve their business.  

She hopes the loan will enable her to earn better income and give her family a healthy living.  In the future, she wants to start a saree shop with her profit.  She is thankful to her generous lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rohini Gandhi Chawak Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Rohini Gandhi Chawak Mahila Samuha is a Self-Help Group which consists of five industrious women. This group is managed by the local NGO, MESP, which helps women improve their livelihood and have a better life. 

Among the five, Arti is the leader who is standing with her hand raised in the picture. She is married and living in Rohini village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are studying in school while the other two small children stay in home. 

Her husband is in the catering business. His earns more during weddings and festival seasons. Arti is in the bari food business.  Bari is the food item which is made of pulses, rice, peas, etc. This food item is very popular in her locality. She prepares and sells it.

She earns around 200 INR per day, but still it is not enough to maintain the family and to meet her children's education expenses. Arti is requesting a loan to buy raw food items to make bari. She hopes this loan will help her increase her family income.   The other members are also seeking loan to expand their livelihoods.

loans.use: to buy raw food items to make bari.

loans.name: Kombo Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is the mother of four schooling children and is in her early fifties. She is not married and for four years she has run her life by depending on a business. She manages a shop selling different products; maize and baking flour, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, match boxes etc. She starts working from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her sixteenth loan which she will use to replenish her shop with new products. With her previous loans she repaid successfully, she improved her shop with more items (present and missing one). She received extra income which she used to cover household expenses and saved part of it. Fatuma dreams of becoming a successful woman. She will be thankful with everyone who will be able to support her group.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Kombo" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new products.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Nura, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nura is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Nura   With this loan, Nura is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rabilu

texts.en: Rabilu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Rabilu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rabilu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Rabilu. With this loan, Rabilu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Letty Maria

texts.es:
La señora Letty es una mujer independiente y muy trabajadora, desde hace 5 años decidió adentrarse en el mundo de los alimentos naturales y para el cuidado de la salud.

Ella prepara y comercializa bebidas de origen natural donde se destaca el café aromático, es una bebida típica en Colombia y de consumo en muchas partes del mundo.

Ella inicio en este negocio impulsada por las ganas de salir adelante y de tener una entra da de dinero estable para su familia.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación e sus bebidas tales como café fresco, plantas aromáticas, endulzantes, entre otros.

Con este préstamo, Letty podrá continuar con su actividad y llevara sus productos hasta más partes de la región.

Apoya el sabor colombiano!!
texts.en:
Letty is an independent and very hard-working woman. Five years ago, she decided to enter the world of natural foods that promote health. She prepares and sells naturally-sourced drinks. Among them, aromatic coffee stands out; it is a traditional Colombian drink and is consumed in many parts of the world.

She was motivated to get started in this business by her desire to support herself and to have a stable income for her family.

She is requesting economic support in order to buy supplies and ingredients for the preparation of her drinks, including fresh coffee, aromatic plants, sweeteners, and more.

With this loan, Letty will be able to continue with her activity and bring her products to additional parts of the region.

Support Colombian flavor!!

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for her business, like coffee and aromatics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing material for bedspreads, seat covers and curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets and jiggies for resale

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Jhuma is a 30-year-old housewife who hails from Maynaguri.  She lives with her husband Kamal and two children (one son and one daughter) in a small village, Debinagar, in the Jalpaiguri district. Both attended school till grade 5.  Their sons are students of grade 3 and 9 in the local schools.

Jhuma is a homemaker, while her husband is a small businessman who deals in paneer (cottage cheese).  He purchases milk from the local milkmen and makes paneer.  He is very active and enterprising, and works tirelessly for the betterment of the family.  

But his main challenge is capital, for lack of which he can't improve his business.  As a result, he can't cope up with the growing increase of the necessary commodities.  His plans are to go ahead with the sale of paneer and improve his business. 

So Jhuma asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more milk to increase her paneer cheese production for sale.  She hopes to get good revenue from her business as the product has a good demand in the market. Her dreams are to provide better education to her children.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for their existing paneer (cottage cheese) business.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Iliya, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Iliya  is ambitious and is aiming to more than 300 bags on his 4 ha field.  “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children, Nura and Rabilu to be educated and have professional jobs” expressed Iliya. With this loan, Iliya is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a Maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Nasiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Nasiru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nasiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Nasiru said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food for my family and provide my children with good education. "Ultimately, I want my children to have good education and professional jobs.” With this loan, Nasiru is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Rise Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her mid 30s is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been selling food for three years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this to buy food to serve more people. She dreams of having a good life style.

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group "Rise" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food to serve more people.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 41 años de edad, estudió poco en la escuela pero aprendió a leer y escribir, está casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos asisten a la escuela. 

Mauricio se dedica a trabajar en la albañilería y a transportar materiales con un camión, mientras que su  esposa solo a los oficios del hogar, él aprendió el trabajo con unos señores de la comunidad con los que trabajaba.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar un terreno ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente.

Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean trabajadores como él, y espera comprar el terreno para dejarles a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 41 years old. He only attended school for a few years but did learn to read and write. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Mauricio works in the brick factory and transports materials with a truck. His spouse is a housewife. He learned his work through some men in his community with who he worked.

He needs a loan to buy some land, as he doesn't have enough cash to do so. His dreams are that his children be hard-workers like himself, and he hopes to buy land in order to leave his children a place where they can live.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Reyna Marisol

texts.es:
La Joven Reyna Marisol habita en el municipio de el sauce departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a brindar sus servicio para sobre vivir a como es el caso de esta joven.

Es una joven de 30 años de edad casada con 2 hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas mantiene el sustento diario a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima.
 
Desde hace ocho años ejerce el trabajo como maestra de educación primaria, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con sus dos hijitos. 

Es de su gran necesidad en su hogar tener una refrigeradora para guardar los alimentos de sus pequeños y un TV ´´ para que estos se distraigan un poco.
Cuenta con el apoyo de Ceprodel y Kiva que le financie un crédito, para la compra de un televisor de 21 pulgadas, y una refrigeradora, ella comenta que son muy útiles en su familia y espera en dios que le aprueben este pequeño financiamiento.
texts.en:
Reyna Marisol lives in the El Sauce municipality in the department of Leon, a city in which the inhabitants offer their work services in order to survive, just like this young woman.

She is a young woman of 30 years of age, she is married with two children under her care. With the little that she earns she is hard pressed to meet the daily needs of her children who she loves and appreciates so much. She has been working as a primary school teacher for eight years, but her dreams are to have a better life with her two little ones.

She is greatly in need of a refrigerator in her home to store the childrens' food, and a TV to entertain them a little. She relies on the support of Ceprodel and Kiva who finance the loan to buy a 21 inch television and a refrigerator. She says that they are extremely useful in her family and she puts her faith in God that this small loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy a 21 inch television and a refrigerator.

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado debido a que depende de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, está casada y su esposo es conductor de buses, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella y 2 ya se acompañaron. 

María se dedica a la venta de platillos típico como pasteles, enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, enredos, etc, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a ese negocio por iniciativa propia, anteriormente trabajó en las fincas podando, sus hijos apoya en las actividades agrícolas que realizan los demás familiares. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales para su negocio de platillos típicos, y otra parte para pagar una deuda que tiene pendiente.

Sus sueños son construir un chalet y poner otro tipo de ventas comestibles, apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y tener un lugar propio para vivir ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and completed 3rd grade in school as her family was very poor. She is married and her husband is a bus driver. She has 5 children, 3 of whom live with her and 2 are now married.

María has been selling traditional food such as pasteles (similar to tamales), enchiladas, plantain tostadas, etc. for 4 years, a business she started herself. Previously she worked trimming on a farm, and she supported her children by farming, which is what the rest of her families does for work.

She needs a loan in part to buy ingredients to make her traditional dishes, and in part to pay a pending debt. Her dreams are to build a home and open another type of food business, and support her children through school and have her own place to live as today she rents.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking and to pay an impending debt.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 66 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y es catequista de una iglesia, tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad y le han dado la dicha de conocer nietos.



Paula no tiene ingresos de ningún negocio, solamente su hija que trabaja le ayuda en lo que puede y de vez en cuando colabora con su esposo en las actividades agrícolas.


Ella necesita el crédito para  comprar cuatro sacos de abono para que su esposo lo aplique al cultivo de maíz y frijol para poder tener una mejor cosecha.

Ella sueña con tener muchos años de vida para ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Paula is 66 years old, studied until the 2nd grade, is married and her husband works in agriculture and is a catechist at church. She has two adult children who have given her the joy of knowing grandchildren. 

Paula does not have income from any business, just her daughter who works and helps her with what she can. Sometimes she works with her husband on farming jobs. 

She needs the loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer for her husband to apply to the corn and bean crops to have a better harvest.

She dreams of living a long time to watch her grandchildren grow.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer for her husband to apply to the corn and bean crops to have a better harvest.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende repuestos para motos y automóviles. Inicio el negocio hace 3 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector. Aprendió del negocio gracias a su hijo mayor quien también es comerciante.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como repuestos de nuevas marcas, aceites y productos para mantenimiento automotor.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Norma is a woman who is motivated to take on the world, and thanks to her efforts has a full life.  

She has a warehouse in which she sells spare parts for motorcycles and cars.  She started her business 3 years ago and in spite of the short amount of time in operation, she has been well-received in the sector.  She learned the business thanks to her adult son who is also a tradesman.

She wishes to expand her offering of products and improve her sales by injecting money into her company.  It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan: to invest in the purchase of merchandise which she does not currently carry, such as spare parts for new makes, oil, and products for automotive maintenance.

She has big hopes for her business and thinks that she will be able to improve her future considerably thanks to the support of these entities which make it possible for people to be able to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase spare car parts and equipment for automotive maintenance

loans.name: Sahul Nohe

texts.es:
Sahul  tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos que son mayores de edad : 39, 35 y 25 años, todos ellos viven en Suchitepequez
	
Durante 20 años han venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de escultor en su casa de habitación ubicado en el lugar mencionado, también teniendo una segunda actividad como encargado de las personas en una constructora en su lugar donde vive. 
	
Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la realización de su más grande sueño que es comprar un terreno en su lugar de origen.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de don Sahul es poder instalar un museo en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el y sus hijos realizan.
texts.en:
Sahul is 59 years old, married and has three adult children: 39, 35 and 25 years old, who all live in Suchitepéquez.

He has been hard working and dedicated to the job of sculptor for 20 years, in his home located in the said location. He also has a second job in charge of the people at a construction company where he lives.

The purpose for why he wants to take out a loan is to realize his greatest dream which is to buy land where he is from.

One of Sahul’s greatest aspirations is to be able to set up a museum in his community so that people can learn about the work that he and his children do.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married. She has two children fourteen and twenty-five years old. Tatyana has her own business.

Tatyana sells women’s clothes at the market. She has three sales outlets and two hired sales persons. Tatyana is a very hardworking person. She wants to develop her business further.

Tatyana is asking for a loan in the amount of 45,000 UAH to increase the assortment of summer and fall clothing. The loan will help Tatyana to better serve her clients and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of summer and fall clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre que agradece mucho a dios y a la vida por encontrase un amigo que le enseño la actividad de que realiza hoy en día la cual es la de prestar servicios de monta-llantas. 

Con esta actividad ha podido mantener a sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad pues ya que en su municipio de cerete es muy difícil conseguir un empleo y el dinero que resulta es gracias a sus habilidades como emprendedor. 

Su negocio se ha visto afectado por la fuerte competencia, donde hay locales mejor organizados, mejor visto e incluso pro la competencia están dejando los precios más económicos lo que pone en peligro la continuidad de su pequeño taller. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de llantas con lo que podrá competir con los precios de los demás talleres, por tal razón es muy importante el crédito pues decidirá la continuidad de su forma de vida, el futuro de sus dos hijos.

Su sueño es continuar con el taller, ampliarlo y poder emplear personas que son tan necesitadas en Cerete.
texts.en:
Carlos is a man who is very grateful to God and to life for having found a friend who taught him  the activity he performs today for a living: servicing and installing tires.

With this trade he has been able to raise his two children aged 8 and 2. In his town of Cerete, it is very difficult to find a job, and the money he earns he does so thanks to his skills as an entrepreneur. 

His business has been threatened by strong competition, from local, better-organized, better-advertised shops, and more generally from competition that is driving down prices and jeopardizing the existence of his shop.

He wants to request a loan to purchase tires with which he will better compete with the prices of other shops. For this reason, the loan is very important as it will decide the  continuity of his way of life and the future of his two children. 

His dream is to continue running the shop and to be able to employ other people who desperately need employment in Cerete.

loans.use: buy tires to compete on price with other local shops.

loans.name: Heidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Heidy tiene 19 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora que solo estudió hasta séptimo grado, ya que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de pan, solo tiene un hijo. 


Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace un buen tiempo, el negocio lo inició por una amiga que la motivó ya que antes trabajaban en una pequeña tienda, lo cual le sirvió de motivación, el negocio lo tiene en su casa que alquila.

Ella necesita crédito para ampliar su negocio, ya que no posee algunos productos en su tienda.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia para ya no alquilar.
texts.en:
Heidy, age 19, is a hard-working young woman who only went to school through the seventh grade.  This is because her parents did not have enough financial resources.  She is married, and her husband sells bread.  She only has one child.

She works in commerce.  She has had a small store for a good amount of time.  She started the business because a friend motivated her to do so.  She used to work in a small store, and that motivated her.  She has the business at her house, which she rents.

She needs the loan to expand her business.  There are some products that she does not have at her store.

Her dream is to have her own house and to no longer rent.

loans.use: to buy products that she does not have for her store.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado en la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, procrearon 7 hijos pero solo 2 viven en casa porque los demás ya se acompañaron.

María tiene un molino y 2 moto-taxis, que son sus principales fuente de ingresos, tiene 8 años de tener el molino y 6 años de tener las moto-taxis, anteriormente tenía una loquera, una tienda de productos básicos, y venta de queso y leche.

Ella necesita el crédito para ayudarle a una hija que está mejorando su casa y le falta dinero para poner el piso.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos tengan casa donde vivir y un negocio con el cual puedan mantener a su familia, para ello piensa continuar trabajando con créditos.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, studied until the second grade of school, is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 7 children, but only 2 of them live at home. The rest live with their life partners.

María has a mill and 2 moto-taxis. These are her main sources of income. She has had the mill for 8 years, and the moto-taxis for 6 years. Previously, she’d had a small grocery store, and she used to sell cheese and milk. 

She needs this loan to help her daughter, who is making some improvements to her house and doesn’t have the money to put the floor.

She dreams about her children having a house to live and a business to support their family. Because of that, she plans to keep working with these loans.

loans.use: to install the floor of her daughter's house.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is a 23-year-old woman who is unwed with one child. She has a small florist business to earn an income. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Olga needs a loan to purchase assorted artificial flowers, floral tapes, clips, a glue gun, glue sticks, cash power and gloves. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with her child's weekly expenses. Olga joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase assorted artificial flowers, floral tapes, clips, a glue gun, glue sticks, cash power and gloves.

loans.name: Upulasi

texts.en: Upulasi is a 21-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells Samoan banana and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Upulasi needs a loan to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, seasoning, salt, plastic bags, taro and bananas. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Upulasi has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, seasoning, salt, plastic bags, taro and bananas.

loans.name: Felicidad Alejandra

texts.es:
Felicidad es una mujer de 42 años de edad casada, madre de dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de frutas de forma ambulante en auto.
Ella es una persona sencilla, carismática, fuerte, luchadora, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en automóvil, en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esta zona se caracteriza por su clima cálido y la humedad de su ambiente.
Felicidad es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado y estatura mediana. Cada día cuando las luces del alumbrado público se apagan dando comienzo a un nuevo día, al que el sol da una calurosa bienvenida, por la ventana de su cabaña Felicidad observa la belleza de su ciudad y se apresura a cargar su fruta en el automóvil, sabe que le espera un día duro de trabajo como frutera, así son llamadas las vendedoras de fruta en su Santa Cruz natal, recorre todos los días las calles y avenidas, otras veces va a la playa y cuando las cosas no van tan bien como ella lo espera entonces recorre Plaza Uno, la plaza central de su ciudad donde comienza la urbanización, muchos sitios de Santa Cruz son buenos para vender, esto le permite sobrevivir a sus hijos a su esposo  y a ella misma. Ella desea tener un lugar fijo donde vender, para incrementar su oferta y obtener mejores beneficios económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Felicidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta por mayor y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felicidad is 42 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works selling fruit from her car. She is a simple person, charismatic, strong, a fighter, enterprising and very hard-working. She sells in the streets from her automobile in the city of Santa Cruz. The area is known for it's hot and humid climate.

Felicidad is dark-skinned, with long braided black hair and of medium stature. Every day when the street lights go out starting a new day, to which the sun gives a hot welcome, Felicidad through the window of her cottage, sees the beauty of her city. She hurries to load the fruit in her automobile knowing that she has a long day of work as a “frutera”. That is the name for fruit sellers in her native Santa Cruz. Every day she travels the avenues and streets and other times she goes to the beach. And when things don't go as well as she expects then she goes to Plaza Uno the central plaza of her city and the beginning of the city. Many places in Santa Cruz are good for selling and this allows her to survive with her children and her husband.

She wants to have a fixed place to sell, to increase her offerings and generate greater economic benefits to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. For these reasons Felicidad is requesting a loan to buy fruit wholesale and improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members, can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Ibrahim. With this loan, Ibrahim is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a 46-year-old farmer from Sabuwar Abuja.  As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Isiyaku is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Yunana,  and  Abba. Isiyaku’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Rufai

texts.en: Rufai remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Rufai, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However,Rufai is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to expand my farmland and become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Rufai. With this loan, Rufai is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is a 62-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 8 years of experience with this business. Tumema needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, foam cups and straws. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tumema has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, foam cups and straws.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Sule, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sule is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Sule. With this loan, Sule is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a 21-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Christina needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, rubber gloves, cucumbers, tomatoes and mayonnaise. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Christina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, rubber gloves, cucumbers, tomatoes and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old and has worked in retail for more than 20 years. She has a store inside a Mexico City market in which she sells beauty products and also gives knitting and sewing lessons. She is asking for a loan to buy shoes for the back to school season. 

Virginia says that she is credit worthy, hardworking, and her biggest accomplishment is paying for her son's university tuition and providing financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as shoes and backpacks for the back to school season

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en: Nafiu remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Nafiu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nafiu is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season. With the increase in income Nafiu hopes to make, he plans to expand his farmland. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are well educated”, expressed Nafiu. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Delmis Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Delmis tiene 26 años de edad, es graduada de la carera de banca y finanzas en la Universidad Autónoma de Honduras, vive con sus abuelos en la colonia lomas del Mayab ubicada en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene una hija de 1 año y medio,.
Delmis se considera una persona responsable, futurista con objetivos y metas claras ha logrado profesionalizarse a base de esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación. Lo que motiva su superación para continuar sus estudios es su mayor orgullo su hija a quien desea brindarle la mejor educación y su familia brindarle un mejor ambiente y calidad de vida, desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país, mediante su preparación y conocimientos profesionales en ambientes laborales y a su familia desea inculcarle aspiraciones de poder plasmarse metas y objetivos para lograr lo que se proponen en la vida.
su mejor consejo a la juventud es que se preparen aprovechen cada oportunidad que tengan para adquirir nuevos conocimientos, que conozcan nuevas experiencias y que se esmeren por ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Delmis is 26 years old. She is a graduate of Banking and Finance at the Universidad Autónoma de Honduras. She lives with her grandparents in the Lomas del Mayab neighborhood of the city of Tegucigalpa. She has a year and a half old daughter.

Delmis is considered a responsible person who looks to the future with clear goals and objectives. She has managed to become a professional through her efforts, work and dedication. What motivates her to excel and continue her studies is her pride for her daughter who she wants to provide the best education and give her a good environment and quality of living.

She wants to contribute to the development of the country through her preparation and professional knowledge in the work field. And for her family she hopes to instill the desire to be able to express goals and objectives to achieve what one wants in life. Her best advise to young people is to study and take advantage of every opportunity that they have to gain more knowledge, have new experiences and do one's best to be better every day.

loans.use: to finish her Master's studies.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta is 53 years old and married with nine children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Vineta needs a loan to buy chemicals, seedlings, a watering hose, a new wheelbarrow, gloves and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Vineta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, seedlings, a watering hose, a new wheelbarrow, gloves and new gumboots.

loans.name: Shakti

texts.en:
Shakti is a 41-year-old housewife who is married to Ramnath in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district. She is blessed with one son and two daughters. Her son is a student of grade 12, and both daughters work as laborers on daily wages. They live in Sahapara in Jalpaiguri district. She passed grade 4 and her husband, grade 8.

Her husband, Ramnath, keeps himself busy in the stall selling "pani puri"  — a popular street snack. It consists of a round hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with flavored water. In the Bengali language it is called "phuchka."

Shakti works hard and manages the household work until night. Her husband’s monthly income is too low to cover their family expenses. Due to their poverty, they are leading a hard life. As their "phuchka" is in great demand in her area, Shakti wishes to expand the business by purchasing different kinds of essential ingredients such as tamarind, chilli, chat masala, peas, potatoes, etc., to prepare more "phuchka." She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more ingredients to increase their business, which will enable her to make the business run smoothly.

Shakti, in the future, wishes to purchase an auto-rickshaw with the profit from the business. She also dreams of giving a better future to her children.

Shakti is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make "panipuri' (a popular street snack).

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita, who is 47 years of age, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who practices livestock farming. She is from Maynaguri, which is a small town in the district of Jalpaiguri. Namita is married and has three adorable sons that she really adores so much and will do anything to protect them and secure their future. 

Cattle farming has always been one of the most enjoyable activities in Namita's life, and she has been doing farming for a few years. Through profits from cattle farming, she has managed to take care of her family. She has a dairy cow, and she supplies milk to her locality. She could not attend to a high grade in school, as her parents could not afford it. Her husband, Tapan, aged 55 years, is a car driver by profession. As he does not have any fixed income, Namita is now the main breadwinner for the family.

Their area has high demand for milk and milk products, so being an enterprising woman, Namita wants to take advantage of this ready market and start a milk products business (such as curds, butter and cheese); that is why she is kindly requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy a dairy cow.

Through the loan, Namita is going to deliver the promise of elevating the quality of life, and also, she is going to secure the future of her children by providing them with a better education.

Namita's plan is to accumulate more profits and be able to purchase a car with them. 

She is highly obliged to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: Lauiula is a 52-year-old widow with eight children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Lauiula needs a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizers, chemicals, sprayers, gloves, a tiller and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Lauiula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, chemicals, sprayers, gloves, a tiller and a new wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Diosa works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Diosa is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more charcoal to offer for sale.

Diosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
Rosa una mujer muy luchadora y con gran pasión por su profesión pues gracias a su venta de pollos y huevos ha podido superar grandes adversidades en la vida como lo fue separase de su esposo y quedo sola con sus 3 hijos que hoy en día tienen 22, 14, 18 años de edad.

Su gran orgullo es saber que sus gallinas y pollos le ayudaron a levantar a sus hijos pero tiene un gran inconveniente y es que como todo negocio pasa por momentos difíciles y como es cabeza de hogar que asume todos los gastos prefirió darles un plato de comida a sus hijos que invertir en su negocio. 

Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar 200 pollitos para criar y concentrado para alimentarlo pues sueña con tener una muy productiva empresa para seguir apoyando incondicionalmente a sus hijos y tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very persevering woman with a great passion for her profession.  Thanks to her sales of chickens and eggs she has been able to overcome great adversity in life, such as separating from her husband and being left alone with her three children (now 22, 14, and 18 years old).

Her big pride is knowing that her hens and chickens helped her raise her children.  She has a big problem, though, which is that every business goes through hard times, and because she's a head of household who's responsible for all the expenses, she preferred feeding her children to investing in her business.

She's requesting a loan to buy 200 baby chicks to raise and concentrated feed to feed them.

She dreams of having a very productive company to keep on supporting her children unconditionally and having a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to buy 200 baby chicks and concentrated chicken feed

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rosana is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 36 years old and has three children who are in school. She is married.

Noeme is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Noeme requested a 8,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Noeme has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Noeme would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. Nilda has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from selling clothes. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Prodencia

texts.en: An 800 USD loan is offered to Prodencia to improve her business. She is married and has two children. Prodencia opened her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like bread, body lotion, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, oils, a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, water, beer and slippers. Prodencia is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Prodencia is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy bread, body lotion, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, oils, a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, water, beer and slippers

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yahaya, Ayuba and  Abubakar. Rahila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Rahila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Rahila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Rahila said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Rahila is not thinking about just this year alone; she said, “in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en:
Alcina runs a kiosk that she opened with her own capital of $1000.00 to help generate income for her family. She has requested a loan of  $800.00 to improve her business through the purchase of commodities such as fish, milk, cigarettes, sugar, salt, noodles, bread and body lotion.

A hardworking woman, Alcina hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, milk, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, bread and body lotion

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Matiyu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Zaina, Mustapha and  Abba. Matiyu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Matiyu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Matiyu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Matiyu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Matiyu is not thinking about just this year alone; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Elvie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise. Elvie has been raising livestock for ten years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ezer Obed

texts.es:
Ezer de 42 años de edad, está casado y su esposa es profesora, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, solamente viven los 5 en su hogar.

Ezer inicio a trabajar en la agricultura, desde los 12 años, ya que sus padres son agricultores, gracias al apoyo de ellos, logró prepararse como profesor, tiene 10 años de desempeñar este cargo y le toca viajar 20 km a su lugar de trabajo, sus turnos son de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.


El crédito sera invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas y sembrar un 10,000 mts de cultivo de maíz.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente. En cuanto a su profesión Ezer está apasionado con la profesión que realiza y desea brindar sus conocimientos a las nuevas generaciones de estudiantes.
texts.en:
Ezer is 42 years old, married to a teacher, and the father of three children. He and his family live in their own home, and two of the children are in school.

Ezer has two careers, as a farmer and an educator. He began farming 12 years ago. His parents were also farmers, and thanks to their support, Ezer was able to study and become a teacher. He has taught for ten years, and works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. at a school 20 km from his home.  

Ezer will use the funds from this loan to purchase farming supplies and plant 10,000 square meters of corn. 

Ezer's ambition is for his children to succeed in school. Ezer himself is passionate about teaching and hopes to impart his knowledge to new generations of students.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and plant 10,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is taking a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, water, milk, fish, salt and slippers. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $500. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, water, milk, fish, salt and slippers.

loans.name: Flavita

texts.en: Flavita is applying for a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is single and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, cards, beer and coffee. Flavita opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, cards, beer and coffee.

loans.name: Golden

texts.en:
Golden is an entrepreneur, an artist, and a craftsman, but above all, he is a family man. Growing up, he admired his father, a business owner who taught Golden the value of controlling your own fate through self-employment. He excelled in music, choosing early on to record and perform as a rap artist rather than play in his high school band.

In 2006, after receiving a tax refund check, Golden and a partner started Henchmen Media Affiliates. They turned a small room in the basement of their Columbus, Ohio, apartment into studio space, and began recording musicians of any style or genre. Golden eventually moved to San Diego in order to diversify Henchmen’s client base to include artists in the L.A. and San Diego areas.

From the beginning, his business has been cash-strapped. Golden wasn't aware of the financing opportunities available to him, instead building his studio piece by piece with his personal savings. 

He will use his Kiva loan to continue to improve his studio, including the purchase of a MASCHINE music production device, as well as a professional-quality condenser microphone.

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Henchmen Media is poised to become America’s next great music production facility.

loans.use: to improve his studio, including the purchase of a MASCHINE music production device, as well as a professional-quality condenser microphone.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is 42 years old, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Lelita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fabio Albeiro

texts.es:
Fabio es un joven de 21 años de edad soltero y muy emprendedor que gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos en su hogar logro empelarse en tallares de confección hasta que llego el día que decidió montar su taller con mucho esfuerzo, humildad y gracias a dos créditos que tuvo en la corporación con excelente habito de pago. 

Como su idea es crecer y poder emplear gente quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de tela, hilos e insumos de confección, con la ayuda de este crédito asacara su propia línea de ropa y podrá emplear personas creciendo y fortaleciendo sus ingresos para apoyar a su madre y padre con los gastos del hogar.

Sueña con tener un taller grande de confección, lleno de empleados y de un excelente ambiente laboral rodeado de grandes sonrisas y música que alegre corazones
texts.en:
Fabio is a very enterprising 21 year old man.  Thanks to the knowledge he gained at home Fabio was able to work in workshops in the clothing sector until the day came when he decided to open his own workshop.  He did this with great effort, humility and thanks to the loans he received from the organization, with his excellent credit record.

Since he wants his business to grow and to be able to employ others, Fabio is asking for a loan  to buy fabric, thread and other articles for making clothing. With the help of this loan he will be able to begin his own line of clothing and employ people, growing and building his income to support his mother and father in paying the costs of the household.  

Fabio dreams of having a big clothing workshop with an excellent work atmosphere, many employees with big smiles and music to lighten their hearts.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other articles for making his line of clothing

loans.name: Aldemar De Jesus

texts.es:
Aldemar es un hombre de 62 años de edad quien junto con su esposa logro constituir una empresa con la ilusión de poder colaborar a sus dos hijos con los gastos de sus estudios profesionales y obviamente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y tener una vejez digna.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y surtido de la canasta familiar como arroz, panela, frijol, entre otros.

Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá mejorar su tienda y tendrá más ingresos para apoyar a su hijo menor de 19 años de edad para que pueda ingresar a una universidad y formarse profesionalmente. 


Su sueño es tener vida para verlo graduarse.
texts.en:
Aldemar, 62 years old, started a business with his wife in hopes of providing for the professional education of his two children. The business also helps Aldemar meet the family's household expenses and he hopes it will ensure a decent retirement. 

Aldemar is applying for a loan to purchase dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt, as well as staple foods such as rice, cane sugar, beans, and others. 

This loan will allow Aldemar to improve his store so that he'll have additional income to support his younger daughter, who is 19, so that she can enroll in university and pursue his professional education.

Aldemar's goal is to live to see his daughters graduate.

loans.use: to purchase items to stock his store: milk, cheese, yogurt, beans, cane sugar, rice, and chocolate.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Ayuba, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. With the increased income Ayuba hopes to make, he plan to provide better food and clothing for his family. “Eventually, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Ayuba. With this loan, Ayuba is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do some home improvements in her parents' house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building an extra room in his in-laws' house.

loans.name: Munkhdul

texts.en: Mr. Munkhdul, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan, he repaired his apartment's roof and created a comfortable environment for his family. His wife is unemployed and his salary can't meet the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car for taxi services. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel compared to other engines. During his day off, he wants to provide taxi services for additional income. He is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Florenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more gasoline to sell to customers.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez works hard to support her family. Mercedez is widowed and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Mercedez has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 54 years old and married with ten children. With three children currently in school, Cirila works very hard to provide for them.

Cirila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, toothpaste, sugar, etc. to sell.

Cirila has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, toothpaste, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Cirila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, toothpaste, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 7 years. Mary Ann earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, sugar, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian es un hombre emprendedor, lleno de entusiasmo y hambre de gloria quien trabajo muchos años en un hotel y cansado de estar empelado decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de jugos de naranja naturales, empezando con una mesita y un exprimidor y gracias a los créditos los cuales pago muy puntualmente. 

Quiere mejorar su negocio y hacer más fácil su trabajo pues está solo y tiene que atender clientela que ha fidelizado brindando productos sanos para sus cuerpos y es gracias a esos clientes que se atreve nuevamente a solicitar un crédito para la compra de un exprimidor hidráulico, ramplas, realizara mejoras locativas como mesas y sillas, comprar una nevera todo por sus clientes retribuyéndole con buen servicio sus gracias por haberle ayudado a ser independiente y crecer como persona y empresario.
texts.en:
Fabian is an industrious man, full of enthusiasm and a desire for success. He worked for many years in a hotel but grew tired of being an employee. Fabian therefore decided to go into business for himself, selling natural orange juice. A loan allowed him to start with a small table and a juicer, and he repaid the debt promptly.   

Fabian would like to improve his business and make his work easier. He runs the business by himself and has to serve the customers who have shown him loyalty for the healthy juices he provides. These customers are Fabian's motivation to apply for a new loan for the purchase of a hydraulic juicer and a trailer. He will also use the loan funds to make improvements to his business, such as adding chairs, tables, and a refrigerator. These investments will allow Fabian to continue providing high-quality service to the customers who have helped him become independent and to grow both professionally and personally.

loans.use: to purchase a hydraulic juicer, a trailer, and a refrigerator, as well as adding chairs and tables.

loans.name: Janchivsembe

texts.en:
Mr. Janchivsembe, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2010. His wife works at a textile factory. Their children go to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, for house renovation. As winter is approaching in Mongolia, his family is in need of a comfortable and warm place.
