Also, after renovation, his family will burn less coal for heating, and then fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install grills on the doors and windows.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Esperanza has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As the married mother of nine children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming cacao.  Nenita is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell to customers.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gandorj

texts.en: Mr. Gandorj, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a jeweler on his own since 2007. His wife helps his business as their workshop is located on his land next to his house. Their children go to high school except their eldest son. Their eldest son last year graduated from his university and is now looking for a job. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials such as silver, gold and copper for his business. In the next three months there are lots of weddings and other ceremonies, so demand for jewelry increases. He is reserving raw materials in order to not run out of inventory.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as gold, silver and copper for jewelry sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Diolita

texts.en:
Diolita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diolita is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Diolita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Diolita requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Diolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Diolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Glenda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and selling charcoal. Glenda is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of spices to sell for her buy and sell spices business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing 26000 PHP through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 12 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn works hard to support her family. Rodalyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 26000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rodalyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Rodalyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Floremel

texts.en:
Floremel is 45 years old and married with two children.

Floremel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Floremel has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years, and she earns additional income from her manicure/pedicure service.

Floremel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ana una mujer cuyo ímpetu y sed de triunfo lo trasmite cada día en sus actividades es por esa razón que un día cansada de la monotonía de ser una ama de casa busca la manera de generar recursos hasta que encontró una entidad que la capacitó en el manejo de maquinaría para la confección.

Con la ayuda de 7 préstamos en la corporación con excelente habito de pago logro  montar su propio taller de confección en su hogar con la ayuda de familiares como podemos ver en la foto, se las trajo y les enseño de esta profesión.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de tela pues principalmente tiene confecciones a terceros pero también saca su propia línea de ropa, también comprara una maquina fileteadora puntada sencilla que tiene un valor elevado y fuera del alcance de sus ingresos. 

Con este crédito aportara en su negocio empleara otra persona y segura creciendo con sus familiares, con sus dos hijos con su esposo hacia un mejor futuro una mejor forma de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman whose drive and hunger for success are seen every day in her activities.  Tired of the monotony of being a housewife, one day she looked for a way to generate income and found an entity which trained her to sew clothes using a machine.

With the help of seven loans from the organization, and with a good payment record for all,  Ana succeeded in starting her own workshop for sewing in her home with the help of relatives, as we see in the photo.  She brought them in and taught them this profession. 

Ana is asking for a loan to buy cloth since she mainly sews clothing  for third parties but is also starting her own line of clothing.  She will also buy an overlock stitch sewing machine which costs a lot and is outside the range of her income.  With this loan she will add to her business, employ another person and  be sure of growing, along with her relatives, her two children, and her husband, towards a new future and a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock stitch sewing machine, cloth and thread

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is single, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, water, slippers, soap and bread. 

She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $600. Felicia is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, water, slippers, soap and bread.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 37 years old and a married man who has two dependent children. He lives in a rural area of Pursat Province. To earn a living, Suon and his wife manage a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost twenty years, with the average income of USD 7 a day. 

Suon wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a farmer from Burus. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Daniel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money to educate my girls: Rejoice and Grace. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 35-year-old farmer from Burus. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Gloria is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition and miscellaneus fees for her younger sister

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie works hard to support her family. Vergie is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle like iron rods, paints, wood, etc.

Vergie has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle like iron rods, paints, wood, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53-years-old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marilyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 64 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Juanita requested 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy wood, nails, and paint for her business.

She successfully repaid  her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Juanita has been in this business for 21 years. Juanita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvira is 35-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Elvira has a bakery business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her business

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
A 800 USD loan is offered to Joana to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of 700 USD. She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store like water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, fish, and eggs. She is generating a good income from selling these kinds of products from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business, after years of involving herself in this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, fish, and eggs

loans.name: Welda

texts.en:
Welda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.  
Welda has been in this business for 4 years.

She requested 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Juanita has been in this business for 15 years.

Juanita requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Concha

texts.en:
Concha is 40 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Concha works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a direct selling business for 7 years and requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory items.

In the future, Concha would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory items.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is a 51-year-old married woman with five children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has operated a general store business for 5 years and requests 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, coffee, and noodles.

In the future, Ada would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, coffee, and noodles.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business.

Julieta has been in this business for 7 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 67-year-old widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shampoo and groceries to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a 47-year-old mother who owns and manages a retail store within the local community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve her business to generate higher income. She planned to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy more stocks of dishwashing liquid, bath soaps, fabric conditioner, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, and frozen foods to resell. She is hoping that through her loan she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dishwashing liquid, bath soaps, fabric conditioner, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, and frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 57-year-old widow with five children; one attends school.

Julieta has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 7 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a retail  chicken business for 5 years.

She requested 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase chicken to sell.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase chicken to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Linda works hard to support her family.

She has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Linda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and to pay electric bills for her video gaming machine rental business.

She successfully paid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to pay electric bills for her video gaming machine rental business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married, hard working entrepreneur with five children. She is 36 years old and has three children who attend school.

Mary Jane has had a frozen foods vending business for 10 years. Mary Jane requested 11,000 PHP  through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

 In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a married, hard working entrepreneur with six children.  She is 50 years old and has three children who attend school.

Mercidita has had a food vending business for 5 years. Mercidita requested 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase cookies and biscuits.

In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cookies and  biscuits.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a tailoring business for 10 years.

Margie requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more  fabric, thread, and zippers for her business.

Margie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  fabric, thread, and zippers for her business.

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
Margery previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan, which was a big help for her direct selling business because she was able to purchase products that helped sustain her business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margery hopes that her business will continue to prosper because she desires to have her own boutique. She also dreams of protection and happiness for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam del Carmen, mayor de edad acompañada con tres hijos menores de edad originaria de chinandega ubicada en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, es una microempresaria y administradora de sus propios negocios que consisten en la venta de productos abarrotes en general que consumimos a diario, como lo son granos básicos, jabones, gaseosas, hielo, etc. Así también cuenta con elaboración y venta de tortillas con experiencia de 8 años en ambas actividades. sus principales clientes son vecinos aledaños de su reparto, sus ventas son 100 % al contado, sus compras son al contado en mercados, distribuidora de esta misma localidad, inicia estos negocios con fondos propios, productos de sus ahorros buscando como un medio de poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, su jornada diaria empieza desde el dia anterior al poner a niquezar el maíz, los cuales realiza en tres tiempos y a la misma vez a tiende su pulperia, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, ver en todos unos profesionales a sus hijos y el de mejorar económicamente sus utilidades, Lilliam se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honrada y con muchos deseos de superación personal, hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo invertir en sus negocios en la compra de granos básicos en general, gaseosas, golosinas, etc. Así también para inversión en materia prima para la venta de tortillas como: maíz, cal, leña entre otros.
Al crecer la magnitud de mis negocios puedo comprar a mejores precios, surtir de todo lo que no pueda tener, los productos más demandantes y así obtener mayor volumen de ingresos y ofertarle mejores precios a mis clientes.
texts.en:
Lilliam del Carmen is a married adult with three minor children. She is from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. This area is characterized by its commercial productivity. She is a micro-businesswoman and runs her own businesses, which are selling grocery products for daily consumption, such as basic grains, soap, sodas, ice, etc., as well as making and selling tortillas. She has 8 years' experience in both activities. Her main customers are the nearby residents. Her sales are 100% paid for up front. She pays for her purchases up front in the markets and a distributor in her community. She started these businesses with her own money from her savings when she was seeking a way to be able to help with the household expenses. Her daily schedule starts the night before, grinding the corn, which she does three times. She also has her store. One of her dreams is to finish building her house and see her children graduate from college and improve her profits. Lilliam is characterized as being a hardworking, responsible, honorable woman who really wants to get ahead personally.  Today she is asking for a loan for working capital to invest in her businesses by buying basic grains, sodas, snacks, etc. She will also invest in ingredients for selling tortillas, such as corn, lime, firewood and more.

When her business grows, she can buy at better prices and stock everything she can't have of the most in demand products so she can make more income and offer better prices to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store as well as buy ingredients to make tortillas such as corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en:
Merylou is 52 years old and single.  

Merylou is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Merylou requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merylou has been in pig fattening for 13 years, and she has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merylou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Paciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Paciana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from direct selling of Avon products. Paciana is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Paciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has an auto repair business in the Philippines.

She requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, and paints.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, and paints.

loans.name: Eder Edu

texts.es:
Eder es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Tiene una pequeña hija quien es el mejor regalo que ha podido recibir en su vida y está muy contento por tenerla junto a él. Lamentablemente no vive con la mamá de su pequeña pero de todas maneras él trabaja mucho para poder brindarle todas las comodidades a su hija, es un padre muy responsable.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 3 años trabaja como Obrero de Campo en un fundo Agrícola de la zona de Ica y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, honesto y siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Eder está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un televisor para su hija para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Así seguirá esforzándose para poder brindarle una educación de calidad a su pequeña y más adelante poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Eder is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Ica with his family. He has a little daughter who is the best gift he has received in his life and he is very happy to have her with him. Unfortunately, he doesn't live with the mother of his little girl, but in any case he works a lot to be able to give his daughter everything she needs. He is a very responsible father.

He is a person who really wants to get ahead. For more than 3 years, he has works as a field laborer at a agricultural estate in the area of Ica and it is going very well for him because he is very hardworking, honest and always striving at everything he does. Eder is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he can improve his quality of life. This way, he will keep striving to give his little girl a quality education and be able to make one of his biggest dreams come true: having his own business.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Paterna requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Paterna has been in this business for ten years now.

Paterna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Jr.

texts.en:
This is Manuel, 42 years old, from the northern area of Delfin Albano. He is married with three kids. Together with his wife, they manage the farm. Manuel is a very supportive person and kind. He loves helping others; that’s why he gained respect in their community. As an addition to his business, he is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizer and manure for his business. 

In the future, Manuel hopes that his business expands so that he can give the quality of living to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for his business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely, 54 years old, is married and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past year, Fely has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. Fely has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of soap, milk, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell. Fely has previously borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of soap, milk, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Adora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried sea cucumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Adora is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her buy-and-sell dried sea cucumber business.

Adora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, 60 years old, is married and has nine children. She has been raising livestock in the Philippines for 10 years and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Remedios has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business. Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel, 37 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 4 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products. Liezel has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Liezel has previously borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Winifreda

texts.en:
Winifreda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Winifreda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Winifreda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Luz Nidia

texts.es:
Hola! Luz Nidia es una madre soltera con un hijo con el que vive en su finca humilde a 30 minutos del municipio Amagá.

Es una persona muy activa que le gusta trabajar con animales en su finca.  Actualmente cría a pollos para luego venderlos. Este es su primer crédito que solicita. Tiene la ilusión de trabajar con gallinas ponedoras de huevos, para poder vender los huevos para aumentar su ingreso y poder proveer para su familia.

Necesita un crédito para comprar gallinas ponedoras de huevos, bebederos, alimentos para las gallinas, y material para construir un gallinero.

El sueño por el cual se esfuerza todos los días es mantener bien a su familia y algún día tener una granja con varias actividades productivas.

¡Impacte la vida de Luz Nidia y su familia através de éste crédito!
texts.en:
Hello!

Luz Nidia is a single mother. She lives with her child in their humble farm, within 30 minutes from the Amagá municipality.

She is a very active person, who enjoys working with animals at her farm. Currently, she raises chickens to sell them later. This is the first loan that she is requesting. She is hoping to work with laying hens, so she can sell the eggs later to increase her income and be able to provide for her family.

She needs a loan to buy laying hens, water troughs, hen feed, and materials to build a henhouse.

The dream for which she works very hard every day is to provide well for her family and, one day, have a farm with several productive activities.

Have an impact on the lives of Luz Nidia and her family through this loan!

loans.use: to buy hens, a henhouse, and hen feed.

loans.name: Larie

texts.en: Larie, a simple farmer, is 40 years old. He is married to Lorily and has three children. Larie is a hardworking person who makes sure everyday to check his farm. Larie is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide so that he can have additional income to sustain his family's daily needs. Larie hopes that, through his farm business, he can see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Hola Prestadores Kiva! Desde niña Luz María se levantaba en la madrugada para empezar sus quehaceres diarios en el campo. Entonces conoce mucho las labores del y la vida en el campo.

Ella invertirá el crédito, con el apoyo de prestadores Kiva, en la compra de gallinas para reventa.

Luz María vive en un sector rural con la ciudad más cercana siendo la de Montería. Su sueño de poder seguir adelante será posible con su apoyo. 

Sin el préstamo, su negocio le rendiría menos ingresos pues se mantendría con mucho menos inventario. Es por eso que ocupa este crédito para poder aumentar su inventario de gallinas para poder incrementar su inventario.

¡Cambie el futuro Luz María con este préstamo!
texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Since she was a girl, Luz María has gotten up before dawn to start her work in the fields, so she knows a lot about work and life in the country.  

She will invest the loan, with the Kiva lenders' help, in buying hens to re-sell. 

Luz María lives in a rural area and the closest city is Montería. Her dream is to be able to get ahead and that will be possible with your help. Without the loan, her business will bring in fewer profits and she will have a lot less inventory. That is why she is asking for this loan to be able to increase her inventory of hens.  

Change Luz María's future with this loan!

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deogracias is from Calamba, where he currently lives with his wife and six children. He is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. Deogracias is a farmer who plants a variety of bananas.

Deogracias wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on his family's table.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer for his banana plantation

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en: Aesthetics enhance one's looks, and manicures and pedicures also provide color. The woman behind this busines is Ailen, 32 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Ailen needs to buy additional accessories for her business to satisfy customers' needs. She has borrowed PHP 5,000 from Paglaum MPC, where she has been a member since 2012. Ailen is very grateful for the help given.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her pediicure/ manicure business

loans.name: Nova

texts.en: Nova requested a PHP 10,000 loan through PMPC to buy additional material for her beauty salon. Nova has been in this business for eight years now. Nova would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and married with four children. Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, toothpaste, juice, biscuits, canned goods, etc. 

Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mailen

texts.en: Mailen has a sari-sari store where she generates income. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She needs to buy stocks like sugar, biscuits, coffee and canned goods to sell to answer the needs of her customers. With that, she borrows money from PMPC amounting to PHP 7,000. She is thankful for the help.

loans.use: to buy stocks like sugar, biscuits, coffee and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Excellence Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes, les membres du groupe Excellence sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, restauration, habits, charbon du bois et poissons fumé. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente  de la restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 2 sacs de mil et 1 sac  de fonio. Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit à Badialan III et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Salimata  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Excellence group is composed of six members, all of them married women living mainly in polygamous households. On the average, they are 33 years of age, with three children. They all live in Badialan III, a district of Bamako. They know each other as relatives or neighbors as well as through their work. The group members work as vendors selling cooked food, clothing, charcoal and smoked fish. With the goal of maintaining their merchandise stock, the group members have decided to reach out to Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Salimata (the one standing on the far right in the photo) is well known as a vendor of cooked food. She plans to user her loan to buy three bags of rice, two bags of millet and one bag of fonio [a West African cereal]. [She] stocks up on cereals in Médine. She sells for cash or on credit in Badialan III and sometimes on order to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Salimata plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals (rice, fonio and millet) in order to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
In 2009, Estrella learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance that it provides to start-ups. Estrella tried her luck in operating a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for trusting her with the money that she used as capital. 

Estrella is requesting to borrow another amount to pay for fertilizer and compost for her cassava plantation. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. Estrella looks forward to better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, aged 34, is from Sibutad. She currently lives with her husband and one child. Juliet is very responsible with her household obligations, seeking to provide the best for her family. She is a farmer who plants rice.

Juliet wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase compost and fertilizer, among other items, so she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Anne Christy

texts.en:
Anne Christy is 29 years old, married with two school-age children. She is a teacher as well as being a young entrepreneur who has ventured into the agricultural business by operating a piggery in Brgy. Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. 

Due to the piggery business, Anne Christy became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative just last year in 2013. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from the said Cooperative to buy pig feed for the piggery. She is aiming to achieve success in her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for the piggery

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman; she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 loan,  Mlongo wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through PMPC to buy more ingredients for snack vending.

She has been in this business for five years now, and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy Ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and widowed, with one son. She is a businesswoman who owns a grocery store and farmland. 

She is residing at Brgy. San Vicente, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Being a capitalist of her own business venture, she is deciding to join  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

Now Letecia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 for buying fertilizers for corn production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for corn production

location.town: Tangub- San Vicente, Tangub City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is widowed with three children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

She is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, and has requested a loan to buy more heads of pig. 

Angelita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future,  she hopes to sustain her family's living.

loans.use: to buy more heads of pig

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is a very skilled farmer with experience in a variety of agricultural areas. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. Adriano has a rice field that he tends every day from very early in the morning. He currently lives with his wife and his four children for whom he has always tried to fight to help them get ahead. 

Adriano hopes to boost his crops and generate greater earnings from them, which is why he is seeking financial help to purchase two sacks of seed and two sacks of fertilizer. The loan will provide him with the opportunity to have a better quality product. Adriano's greatest dream is to have his own house and to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of seed and two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is a native of Dipolog. She is 25 years old and single. Iris supports her parents through her sari-sari (variety) store business.

Iris is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She wants to increase her inventory to cater for the needs of her customers. Iris is so thankful to Paglaum due to their trust in her.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 66 years old, married and lives in Dicayas, Dipolog. She has four children. Her husband earns a meagre income. Beatriz believes in determination and hard work. 

She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative recently, having faith in their true service and assistance to needy people. The Cooperative has urged her to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. Beatriz has requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC in order to have additional capital to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

The couple’s aspiration is to send their children to school to obtain a degree and to provide them with a good quality life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Justina Emperatriz

texts.es: Justina Emperatriz mayor de edad madre soltera con dos hijos mayores e independientes originaria de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, en la vida ha sido una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, para cumplir cada una de sus sueños y metas. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar de estudiar hoy en día su sueño es ver formado a su hijo en un profesional, gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante es administradora y propietaria de una pulpería la cual consiste en una pequeña tienda donde oferta productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, queso, crema, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas,toallas sanitarias, papel higiénicos, detergentes, jabón, bolsitas de shampoo,entre otros mas, su jornada diaria inicia desde muy temprano dedicándoles una doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. sus compras son al contado en distribuidoras y mercados de esta localidad y camiones distribuidores que les ofrecen sus productos en la puerta de su casa, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Justina Emperatriz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Justina Emperatriz is an older, single mother with two grown and independent children. She is originally from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, a zone characterized by its commercial production. In life she has been a hardworking, responsible woman with a lot of desire for self-improvement and to achieve each one of her dreams and goals. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she could not finish her studies. Today her dream is to see her son become a professional. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, she is the manager and owner of a grocery business that consists of a small store where she offers grocery products for sale in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, matches, juices, sodas, cookies, sanitary napkins, bathroom tissue, detergents, soap, shampoo packets, among other things. Her day’s journey begins very early, dedicating 12 hours a day to offering her products. The business is located in her house of residence. Her purchases are made in cash from the distributors and markets of her town, and distributor trucks that offer their products at the door of her house. 

The objective of this new financing is to invest in working capital and to stock her business in the buying and selling of grocery products, so that in the not too distant future she may obtain a better income. Justina Emperatriz appreciates the help Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by purchasing consumer goods used at home such as: bulk grains, frozen products, sodas, sweets, among other things.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is a 36-year-old man who is married and blessed with two children. He has been practicing cash-crop farming for the last 10 years and makes a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP. He has applied for his eighth loan, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizers in preparation for the planting season. He hopes to make a lot of profit, which he plans to use to pay back his loan as well as save towards the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
This is Sabelita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy additional stocks of toys, accessories and other products needed in her buy-and-sell business. Besides this, she was also able to establish another business and send her children to school.

At present, Sabelita manages a small variety store as her additional source of income. Together with her husband, she works hard to provide for their family's everyday needs. She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the new loan to buy additional supplies of toys, accessories and other products needed in her businesses. Her profits from the businesses will definitely help sustain her daily needs and provide for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sabelita dreams of her businesses continuously expanding and becoming stable. She hopes that her children will finish their studies and will always be guided and protected by the grace of God. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toys, accessories and other products needed for her businesses.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Diana has been in this business for 20 years. Diana earns more income from a general store.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Phane

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Phane, a 25-year-old mother who is full of energy and a very hard worker. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good and favourable weather patterns that support farming. She is the mother of two children who are under her care from her marriage. Phane completed her secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. 

Phane has been farming for the past six years and through mixed farming, she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Moraa' (from a person's name). Although Phane passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank.

Phane comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Phane to irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. This loan will turn around the life of Phane as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of water, hence saving her time.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a single mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Sidi has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces the challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Sidi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. With this 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo is a hardworking woman. She is 24 years old and lives in a rural area with her parents. She is divorced. Since childhood, she has helped her parents with animal husbandry. She began her own business in animal husbandry four years ago. She has a cowshed in her house and feeds cows and milks cows. She sells the milk cows to other local people, and her customers are glad they buy her milk products. Surayo is going to increase her working capital and in this way, expand business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cattle. From the profits of her business, she will improve her living conditions. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is 66 years old and earnestly works hard for her family. As a widow, she finds it is hard to support their needs but she strives hard to earn an income through her sari-sari (variety) store business. 

Recently, Engracia has applied for a loan to purchase more canned goods, soft drinks and noodles to sell. She hopes for a fast roll-over of capital so she can earn and save more for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, soft drinks and noodles to sell

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan buys, cooks and sells balut (cooked fertilised duck eggs with embryo) and penoy (cooked fertilised duck eggs without embryo). She has been successful in this business for years, and has repaid her previous loan used for the business. Susan also finds ways to improve her income through selling different varieties of candies and "samalamig" (the Filipino term that refers to thirst-quenching juices).

In relation to this, Susan would like to take out a new loan to help to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more eggs and other products that are needed in making balut and penoy. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of good health and success in life and business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita landed at the right place to find her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her chance to expand her farming business. She feels that running a small sari-sari store would not suffice the needs of her family. 

PMPC to Teresita came as a rescue, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She has been lent an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  She perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: with land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a married woman and has three children. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. For the past four years, she has operated a goat meat selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. With this 50,000 KES she wants to purchase seven goats and resell them at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats to re-sell at a profit.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates for the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

Luvuno has operated a goat meat selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other goat meat operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for medicines and tests, and pay for doctor visits.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn has always dreamed of expanding her sari-sari store by increasing her inventories of soft drinks. She has realized the fast sales of soft drinks when fiesta is approaching. Jonalyn believes it will help her to support her two children. She used her loan to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yeiber David

texts.es:
Yeiber a sus 26 años de edad se ha soñado siempre como el propietario de un  gran almacén de ropa y gracias a la corporación que la va a facilitar una importante suma de dinero y a su experiencia que ha adquirido como vendedor ve ese sueño cumplirse. 

Es padre de una pequeña hija de 1 año de edad y quiere solicitar un crédito para conformar su almacén de venta de ropa de hombre y dama y accesorios como bolsos, diademas, pulseras, collares etc.
 

Con el crédito podrá crear una estabilidad econo0mica y tendrá un medio de ayudar en su hogar con los gastos el crédito lo distribuirá de la siguiente manera.

•	7’000.000 en compra de surtido como variedad de ropa para hombre y dama y los accesorios 
•	1’000.000 en compra de vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
•	2’000.000 para las adecuaciones del local como pintura, publicidad etc.
Este crédito es de suma importancia para Yeiber pues apostara todo en él toda sus esperanzas están puestas en este crédito ya que la suma de dinero es muy alta y tiene la fe y la esperanza puesta en dios que su almacén será todo un éxito y que apoyara incondicionalmente a su familia e hija.
texts.en:
Yeiber, at his 26 years of age, has always dreamt of being the owner of a clothing department store and thanks to the corporation that is going to provide an important sum of money, and his experience that he acquired as a salesman, that dream will be realized.

He is the father of a small one-year-old daughter and he wants to request a loan to form his store selling clothing for men and women and accessories such as bags, headbands, bracelets, necklaces, etc.
 
With the loan he will be able to create economic stability and will have a way to help his household with expenses. He will distribute the loan in the following way.

• 7’000.000 in the purchase of stock such as a variety of clothing for men and women and the accessories
• 1’000.000 in the purchase of display cabinets to show his products
• 2’000.000 for the remodeling of the store such as paint, advertising, etc.

This loan is of great importance to Yeiber because he will bet everything on it. All of his hopes are put on this loan since the sum of money is very high and he has faith and hope put in God that his store will be a total success and that he will support his family and his daughter unconditionally.

loans.use: to start his business of selling clothing and accessories. He will buy clothing for men and women and accessories such as bags, shoes, and bracelets.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Mariam has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mariam dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, and beans for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, and beans for sale in her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with eight kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Fatuma sells goat meat at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a butchery business in the future. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita works hard to support her family. Amelita is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.  Amelita has been in this business for 30 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Estelita is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her dried fish making business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 44 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Amor works very hard to provide for them.

Amor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Amor has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Amor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en: Felipina is a married resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental who believes in hard work and determination.  She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, having faith in true service and assistance to needy people. It urges her to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. She requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC after having been a member.  She accepted the loan in order to have additional capital to restock her store with basic commodities. It is her aspiration to provide a good quality of life to her family and children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analy is 38 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Analy has a general store business in the Philippines. Analy requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Analy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Analy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nilda is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fish to dry.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry.

loans.name: Ciise Group

texts.en:
Saado is a 55-year-old businesswoman. She has 10 children whom their father died two years ago. She has a tea shop in Gabiley town which she started in 1994 when civil war broke out in Somaliland. Surprisingly, when she was starting the tea shop she had no money to start her small business. To start the tea shop, she borrowed several kilograms of sugar from her relative. Fortunately, her small business grows day after day, until she used the money to pay school fees and to feed her family. Now, her business is a medium enterprise and she requested from Kaaba Microfinance a loan for $700 to expand. She sells Somali tea and local foods. 

Saado is the one who sitting in front of the group photo and raising her hand. She is the leader of a group known as Ciise. The group consists of 10 members which 6 of them are female while the remaining 4 are male. Each and every client has an existing business and also everyone will get his/her loan separately.

loans.use: to expand her tea shop.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Ega operates a goat meat selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a butchery business in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to pay school fees and buy goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy goats for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita manages a hog raising business in their village. In addition, she also sells a variety of grocery items, such as noodles, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and drinks. Teresita has been in the retail business for thirteen years. She is managing well both of her businesses so that she can improve the way of life for her three children. Teresita’s husband is a driver whose income serves to provide their daily needs.

With regards to her business, Teresita wants borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more grocery items to sell. Her sari-sari store earnings will be used to invest in hog feed for maintenance. Teresita hopes to succeed with her businesses in able to give a better way of living for her children. She wanted them to obtain a college degree soon.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonia is 50 years old and has two children, who are currently in school. Antonia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Antonia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a business buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 43-year-old married man with six children, living in Dhamar City of Yemen. His oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest one is 6 years old. He has a University education, and now he is an employee. The money that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Ahmmed's house lacks of many of home appliances, and he can't afford this. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to furnish the house and to buy new home appliances. For this reason, Ahmmed is requesting a loan of 75,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new refrigerator for the house. 

Ahmmed looks forward to improving the condition of his family. He hopes to prepare his house for the marriage one of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Joana to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. Only three of her children are school. She has a very modest home. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as beer, Sagiko, Fanta, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, noodles, milk and water. She has been involved in business activities since 2001. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Joana independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improving their living conditions in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy beer, Sagiko, Fanta, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, noodles, milk and water

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Delia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chombo

texts.en:
Chombo is a married woman with seven kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Chombo operates a charcoal selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to pay school fees and buy charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale and pay school fees.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica is 63 years old and married.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Dominica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, including soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.  

Dominica has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, including soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat vegetables, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a buy and sell of fish business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 42 years old, married and has one daughter. His family is IDP and they live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. Ibrahim raises vegetables (greens, potatoes, onions, tomatoes and so on) and fruit trees (apples, pears, etc.). His monthly income is 150 AZN and he has 17 years of experience in this field. He gets an additional small income working as a driver.

People living in IDP settlements have higher demands for products such as fresh fruits and vegetables. They prepare juice, fruit pies, etc. and make different kinds of salads.
 
Ibrahim needs to improve the condition of his garden. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to buy garden tools and repair the garden. He wants to get more money in order to improve his family's hard life.

loans.use: to buy garden tools

loans.name: Askia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe ASKIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame BINTOU assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  ASKIA, fait la vente  des  boissons (coca cola, ananas, tonic).
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 4 cassiers de boisson( coca cola, ananas, tonic) au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail  à  SANOUBOUGOU I à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Askia group are married women who on average are 32 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Sanoubougou I, one of the populous neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
