The profits will allow her to increase her savings, better help her children, and to eventually finish her house.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of bananas, 2 basins of mangoes, and 3 bags of passionfruit.

loans.name: Michelle Guinell

texts.es: Michelle es una joven emprendedora que a pesar de su corta edad ha decidido salir adelante, está casada y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su pequeño hijo. Estudia derecho ya que le gusta su carrera y tiene familia que se han desempeñado en la misma carrera. Solicita el crédito para pagar las mensualidades de su carrera. El crédito le ayudara a salir adelante con sus estudios. Dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentran graduarse y encontrar un buen trabajo. Su meta próxima es terminar su año lectivo con buenas calificaciones y optar a una beca en su universidad.
texts.en:
Michelle is a young entrepreneur. She is married and has a young son but, despite her young age, has decided to move forward in her life. She studies law as she would like this as a career and she has family in the same field. She is requesting this loan to help her continue paying her fees to study. 
Among her future plans, she aims to graduate and find a good job. Her next goal is to finish school this year with good grades and then apply for a scholarship at university.

loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Dilcia Yanneth

texts.es: Dilcia, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Dilcia trabajo varios años en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió poner su propio negocio, lleva 10 años trabajando en lo propio donde vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, harina, carnes, golosinas, refrescos, lácteos, jabón y otros abarrotes. Desde que inicio ha invertido varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el noveno ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, carnes y otros para seguir surtiendo y generando ingresos para su familia. Su plan es agrandar el negocio y darle educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Dilcia is 35 and is a single mum with one daughter. She lives in a village in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She worked for various years in a maquila (textile factory) but, when she was left without work, she decided to set up her own business. She has worked in this for 10 years, selling basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, sea butter, beans, flour, meat, snacks, refreshments, dairy produce, soap and other grocery items. Since she started, she has invested in various loans.

Dilcia is currently asking for her ninth loan for 10,000 HNL in order to buy items such as basic grains sugar, shea butter and meat to carry on stocking her business and generating an income for her family. Her plan is to increase her business and provide an education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy items such as basic grains, sugar, shea butter and meat to continue stocking her business.

loans.name: Doris Evelyn

texts.es:
Doris de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta los primeros años de bachillerato, está felizmente acompañada y su pareja trabaja como empacador en una empresa de productos de ferretería.

Doris tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, y los vende luego de un tiempo, aprendió este negocio hace 2 años cuando se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, la granja la tiene en su casa y están pendiente de cuidar a sus animales durante el día.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cuatro sacos de concentrado para alimentar a ochenta pollos que ya tiene en su granja.

Ella sueña con llegar a tener una granja grande de pollos y de esta manera tener suficientes ingresos para gozar de una excelente calidad de vida
texts.en:
Doris, 35, studied until the early years of high school, and happily lives with her partner who works as a packer in a hardware store.

Doris has a small chicken farm, where they are fattened up and then sold. She learned this business two years ago when she needed to help her family. The farm is at her home so she is able to look after the animals during the day.

She needs a loan to buy four bags of feed to feed eighty chickens that she already has on her farm. 

Her dream is to have a large chicken farm and thus have sufficient income to enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four bags of feed to feed eighty chickens that she already has on her farm.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is a 35-year-old married man with four children, living with them in their own house in Dhamar. His oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. He has a University education, and now he is an employee in the public sector. His salary is good to cover all the expenses of the family, but it is not enough to purchase some of home appliances. His house lacks many home appliances and he can't afford them. For this reason, Abdulhamid is requesting a loan of 75,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new refrigerator for his house. 

Abdulhamid looks forward to improving the living condition of his family. He hopes to purchase all new home appliances for his house.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for his house.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. Meriam is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice and rice grains to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Meriam would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and rice grains to sell

loans.name: Bacary Souadou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 12 Décembre 2011 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui après cinq cycles ont développé un bon esprit de groupe renforcer par les forts liens de parenté du fait qu’elles vivent toutes dans le même village. Elles sont très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu, particulièrement centrés dans le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Bacary, âgée de 31 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles âgés de 02 à 13 ans. Elle gère sa propre boutique d’alimentation  au village où elle vend du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, le thé, du lait, des condiments, du café, divers biscuits et bonbons et autres produits de consommation courante. Elle achète sa marchandise en gros et demi gros au marché commune pour la revente au détail dans son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire réapprovisionner sa boutique par l’achat de 06 sacs de riz de 50kg à 13 500 Fr CFA le sac, du sucre 02 sacs, un sac d’ognon et de pomme de terre et divers bouillons et épices.

Les bénéfices seront utilisés en grande partie à la gestion des charges scolaires, sanitaires et d’habillement de ses enfants et d’elle même d’une part et d’autre à augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on December 12, 2011.  It consists of women who have developed a great team spirit after five loan cycles, reinforced by strong family ties from all living in the same village.  They are very involved in the growth of their income-generating businesses, especially centered 
on small business and seasonal farming during the rainy season. Ms. Bacary, age 31, sitting at the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of this group.  She is married and mother of five children, three boys and two girls, ages 2 to 13.  She runs her own food store in the village where she sells rice, sugar, oil, tea, milk, condiments, cafe, cookies, candies, and other consumer products. She buys her supplies in bulk and half-bulk at the communal market for resale in her village.  With her new loan, she wants to restock her store with six 50-kg bags of rice for 13,500 FCFA, two bags of sugar, one bag of onions and potatoes, and various bouillons and spices. The profits will be used in large part to pay for school fees, healthcare, and clothing for her children and herself. The remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy six 50-kg bags of rice, two bags of sugar, one bag of onions, potatoes, bouillon, and spices.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 80 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 190,00 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Asuncion has been in this business for 17 years. 

In the future, Asuncion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 30, and married with 5 children aged between 2 and 10, 3 of whom attend school. He deals in produce, particularly maize, and makes extra income from a bar business. He started the business to increase his household income. Deo’s main hope for the future is expanding his business despite the high competition.

He is acquiring loan capital to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Yenifer Tatiana

texts.es:
Yenifer una mujer de tan solo 19 años de edad que tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad, dedicada a la venta de mercancía y accesorios entre ellos ropa para hombre y dama, tarjetas decorativas. 

Monto el negocio gracias a un microcrédito que solicito en la corporación que le dio la mano cuando quedo soltera y mirando que hacer para sostenerlo y nuevamente requiere uno pues su negocio está en etapa de crecimiento y consolidándose pro lo que quiere comprar mayor variedad de surtido en ropa.

Para ella es muy importante este crédito pues de este dependerá el éxito de su negocio y más aún que su hija depende económicamente de ella al igual que su familia. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio bien consolidado y atractivo al público
texts.en:
Yenifer is a woman of only 19 years old and has a little 1 year old boy. She makes a living selling merchandise and accessories such as men and women's clothing and decorative cards. 

She started the business through a request to a microcredit corporation that gave her a hand when she was single and looking for what to do to sustain. Once again she requires one because her business is in a stage of growth and is becoming established. Thus she wants to buy a greater variety of clothes.

For her this loan is very important because she will depend on it for the success for her business. Further, her daughter is financially dependent on her as well as her family. Her dream is to have a well established business that is attractive to the public.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men and women, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Hola desde Colombia!  Oscar es un hombre casado y del campo que es muy trabajador. 

Su dedicación y ética de trabajo lo demuestra todos los días. Pues se levanta temprano todos los días para empezar a trabajar a las seis de la mañana en el campo.  Lleva nueve años dedicándose a la cultivación y busca proveer un mejor futuro para él y su pareja.

El crédito permitirá a Oscar comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, fertilizantes y abonos que aumentaran la producción de sus cultivos. Esto le resultara en un incremento de sus ingresos.

Sin el apoyo de Interactuar y Kiva sería muy difícil para Oscar tener acceso a un financiamiento para su negocio de cultivación pues vive un una zona rural cerca del municipio de Montería. Oscar trabaja para seguir adelante con su esposa atraves de su cultivación de varios cultivos.

¡Apoye a Oscar con este crédito para que pueda seguir trabajando para un mejor futuro!
texts.en:
Greetings from Colombia! 

Oscar is a married, hardworking entrepreneur who began farming nine years ago to provide a better future for himself and his wife. Oscar's dedication and work ethic have been evident every single day of his farming career. He gets up each morning in time to begin working in the fields by six a.m. 

This loan will allow Oscar to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, and manure. These investments will boost crop yields, which in turn will increase Oscar's income.    

It would be extremely difficult for Oscar to obtain loans for his farm without the support of Interactuar and Kiva, as his farm is in a rural area near the town of Montería. Oscar grows a variety of crops so that he and his wife can enjoy a better life. Please support Oscar with this loan so that he can keep striving for a better future!

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome  is 25 years old. He is single.  He sells  gas cylinders  and has been in a business for three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more  bottled gas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Dennis Alejandra

texts.es:
Denis una muy carismática mujer de 18 años de edad llena de ánimos, de sed de triunfar, de esperanzas de ilusiones y sobretodo ganas de trabajar, a su corta edad quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y surtido en accesorios como lo son pulseras, collares, perfumes entre otras cosas. 

Adquirió experiencia trabajando en su colegio vendiendo dulces y quiere conformar su negocio por eso solicita su ayuda que confíen en ella y en sus habilidades de vendedora pues quiere estudiar quiere pagarse sus cuentas, tener capital para ayudar a su madre y poder constituir un negocio que genere muchos empleos.
texts.en:
Denis is a very charming young woman, just 18 years old, but full of energy and drive to succeed. She wants more than anything to work. Despite her youth, Denis wants to apply for a loan to purchase a display cabinet, jewelry, and accessories such as bracelets, necklaces, perfumes, and other items.   

Denis has experience selling candy in high school. She wants to use the funds from this loan to establish her business, so she's asking for your help and for you to trust her and her ability as a saleswoman. Denis wants to continue her studies, pay her bills on time, earn the money to help her mother, and build a successful business that will employ many people.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces, and earrings.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: This is Michael, a 37-year-old from Antagan who married to Irene. They have two kids. Michael has been managing a farm business for seven years. He is a very loving person, most especially toward his family. He always makes sure that he can see to all the needs of his family. For that reason, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm business. Teodoro hopes someday that he can see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm business

loans.name: Cesar Fabian

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre trabajador, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Es una persona que desde muy joven ha trabajado debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos, él tuvo que apoyar a su familai en lo que podía. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera Universitaria debido a su economía.
Tiene dos maravillosos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes siempre se ha esforzado para poder brindarles un mejor futuro y una educación universitaria para que ellos puedan salir adelante. Desde hace más de 20 años se trabaja como Cargador de materiales de construcción y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, luchador, honesto y siempre ha sobresalido en su centro laboral.
Cesar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un vehículo de segunda para poder transportarse de su casa a su trabajo, con esto podrá ahorrar dinero de sus pasajes y podrá comprar artefactos para su hogar y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Gracias a esto Cesar seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a hard-working man aged 61. He is married and lives in Ica together with his family. He is someone who has worked from a very young age, as his parents had a low income and he had to support his family as much as he could. Unfortunately, he was not able to study for a university degree because of his economical situation.

Cesar has two marvellous children who make him very proud, and for whom he has struggled hard in order to provide them with a university education and a better future. He has worked for more than 20 years as a building-materials handler. His work is going well as he is responsible, hard-working and honest, and because he has always excelled at his work.

Cesar is grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their help, he will be able to buy a second-hand vehicle to be able to travel between his house and his workplace. This means he will be able to save money on fares and to buy things for the home, thus improving his family's living conditions. Thanks to this, he will continue to work hard so that in the future he will be able to help his family progress.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand vehicle.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality. Especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed, she experiences low turn out. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase manicure and pedicure equipment, facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure equipment, facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food

loans.name: Favio Luis

texts.es:
Los pájaros cantan la primera melodía de la mañana, anunciando junto con el quiquiriquí de un gallo la hora de ordeñar la vacas de Favio, un hombre caracterizado por su amor por la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 17 años, cuando ayudaba a su abuelo a cultivar maíz y frijoles. Al mismo tiempo, él era el encargado de cuidar el ganado, ganándose un poco de dinero con el sudor de su frente desde pequeño, dinero que no dudo en ahorrarlo para poder convertirse en el microempresario con orgullo que es ahora. Favio no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero con su esfuerzo y dedicación se ha convertido en un reconocido agricultor y ganadero. 
Ahora a sus 36 años es un hombre casado y padre de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, a quienes afortunadamente les ha inculcado el estudio. Él comercializa sus productos en Managua con el apoyo de sus trabajadores. En ocasiones compra y vende cerdos, pues no hay oportunidad que desaproveche. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresario, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para comprar una vaca e iniciar la huerta postrera de maíz y frijoles, que le generaran grandes ventas y buenos ingresos. Entre sus planes está limpiar su terreno para la próxima siembra e ir incrementando poco a poco su número de vacas para ordeñar.
texts.en:
Birds singing the first song in the morning, along with the rooster, means it is time to milk the cows for Favio, a man who has loved agriculture and livestock for 17 years, since he helped his grandfather grow corn and beans. At the same time, he was in charge of looking after the livestock and  has been earning a little money from hard work since childhood, money that he did not hesitate to save in order to become the proud entrepreneur he is today.

Favio had no opportunity to study, however with effort and dedication, he has become a well-known farmer and rancher.

Now, at 36, he is married and has to children aged 17 and 9 years old, who he fortunately encouraged to study. He sells his products in Managua with the help of his employees. He sometimes buys and sells pigs because this is not an opportunity to miss.

His dream is to grow as an entrepreneur, so he is requesting this loan to buy a cow in order to begin the final corn and bean season, which will generate great sales and good income. Among his plans for the future, he aims to clean up his land for the next sowing season and gradually increase the number of cows for milking.

loans.use: to buy a cow and begin the final corn and bean season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has an upholstery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her upholstery business. She has been in this business for 36 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her upholstery business

loans.name: Jany Yudith

texts.es:
Jany es una mujer luchadora, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Imperial junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 maravillosos hijos quienes son su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante y por quienes desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 20 años trabaja vendiendo golosinas en un triciclo que tiene, con el cual puede transportarse a diversos lugares de la ciudad para ofrecer sus productos. Le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Jany está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder ampliar su negocio de venta de golosinas y así pueda tener mayores ingresos. Con esto ella seguirá laborando con el mismo entusiasmo y una de sus metas a corto plazo es poder innovar con otro negocio.
texts.en:
Jany is a determined woman who is 40 years old, single, and lives in Imperial with her family. She has 3 marvelous children who are her main motivation in life to be successful. Since she was very young she has been working to provide them a better future. 

For more than 20 years she has worked selling treats on a tricycle that she has, which she uses to transport herself to various locations in the city to offer her products. She is doing very well because she is very hardworking, responsible, honest, and above all because she always exerts herself in everything she does. 

Jany is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide she will be able to buy merchandise to expand her business of selling sweets and thus have a higher income. With this she will continue working with the same enthusiasm. One of her short-term goals is to create another business.

loans.use: Compra de golosinas para implementar su negocio

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with three kids. She has been involved in a farming business for five years. She is a very responsible mother who loves to serve her family. She always makes sure that she can give all their needs to her family. To have additional income she is asking for a loan amounting to Php 17,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farming business.

In the future, Teresita hopes that her business expands so that she can give a better quality of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farming business.
